40141440.review:
I don't like Steampunk, but I enjoyed this game. That's how good it is.

My gripe with steampunk is it's mostly stuff painted brown with gears slapped ontop. Artifex Mundi's Clockwork Tales features a setting that's a mix of fantasy and sci-fi, with a Victorian/Industrial flare, in which the steampunk elements both play a role in the plot and a role in the puzzles. That's what I want in a good steampunk work, and that's what Artifex Mundi delivers.

The heroine of Clockwork Tales is an inventor's ward/apprentice/sort of daughter. She's trying to save him from the dieselpunk Nazi? standins, and has a mechanical bird who helps her along the way. Expect to solve puzzles like making a set of glider wings out of scraps and smashing robots with chandeliers. 

There's a good number of puzzles and hidden object puzzles, which are all around middle to hard in terms of difficulty. Apparently, it took me 5 hours to finish this game 100%, so I'd say this is a medium-long length game for Artifex Mundi and a really good value. At least a few of the puzzles are uncommon types of Artifex Mundi puzzles, so if their games are getting repetitive to you (from having played so many of them), this is probably the game for you.

There are collectibles that aren't super hard to find and do match the theme of the game (cute bejeweled robot bugs).

There is a bonus adventure, and from what I remember, it's a little challenging.

If you prefer Gothic over Steampunk, check out Scarlett Mysteries, also by Artifex Mundi.

39522640.review:
[h1]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/h1]
...is a hidden object puzzle game. Evangeline Glass sets out for the town of Hochwald to find her surrogate father, Dr. Ink, who has been investigating tremors happening across steampunk Gottland.

[h1]⚠ [u]Description[/u][/h1]
You begin your adventure in the town section, eventually moving to the castle section, and finally the volcano section. Within each section, you can (and are often required to) backtrack to find inventory items. A fourth section, under the guise of a prequel, is available once the main game is completed.

Puzzles are varied, such as moving panels, rotating gears, table labyrinths, maths, and, of course, the staple Hidden Object puzzle where you have a fixed scene filled with trinkets in which you must correctly identify some from a list at the bottom of the screen.

[h1]☺ [u]Pros[/u][/h1]
Hidden object puzzles have additional variety to them. Sure, you have the usual list of items to find, but others will focus on finding pieces and parts in order to build bigger parts, or a series of interacting objects until you are left with the item you need. All of these result in inventory items you use elsewhere or with other object in traditional point & click style.

Animations, while simple, respect the gorgeous hand-drawn aesthetics of the game. Hidden object scenes are also well drawn, with little-to-no distinction between removable object and the background panel. If a scene is used twice, objects removed the first time won't magically reappear on the second use.

The background music adds to the atmosphere or mystery, helping you feel you're in a foreign region or time, and the voice acting of main characters is sufficient to avoid breaking the immersion (with some notable exception, such as Mr. Rotten Apple).

[h1]☹ [u]Cons[/u][/h1]
It's too short, shorter than other games of the genre. My 5 hours of play include me being away from my computer for a while, as well as being stuck on two of the more difficult puzzles. The quantity of scenes isn't the problem, but you barely spend any time in many of them. The story is short as well, the speampunk setting isn't exploited enough.

With the exception of a few puzzles, most of the game is extremely easy. There's not as much clutter as you'd normally expect from the hidden object puzzles, most of which you'll need to do twice (with even less clutter the second time). The hidden steambugs are very hard to miss. Most inventory-based items are used immediately after finding, in many cases the game prevents you from picking them up until you actually need them.

[h1][b]Verdict[/b]: ★★★☆☆ - [i]"It's up to you."[/i][/h1]

It's nice to play another [i]Artifex Mundi[/i] game after a few disappointing hidden object games. However, it is not the best game in their collection. This is why I'll only recommend [i]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i] to real fans of the genre, keeping in mind there are some better ones out there.

—————————————————————————
[i][b]This was just my opinion.[/b]

If you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up, and feel free to check out more of my (purely opinionated) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/CJsOpinions/]reviews[/url].[/i]

В альтернативном мире в стиле паропанка происходят странные землетрясения и доктор Инк отправляется в маленький городок выяснить причины этого. Он выясняет что-то интересное и вызывает свою помощницу Гласс на помощь. Но вскоре после её приезда Инка похищают и дальше разбираться придется уже самим.

35877267.review:
I felt a bit mislead at this game being called a HOG when there were so many puzzles to solve and much object gathering and combining, but I enjoyed the story enough to overlook that.
I found the main story to be good, but felt that the Ink's prequel was the best part of the story.

Pros
I love the Steampunk theme!
You get Matthew, an adorable clockwork bird, as a helper. Honestly, I wasn't sure how I would feel about a mechanical bird but over the course of the adventure he really grew on me. :)
Beautiful artwork of a snowy remote mountain village and an inventor's castle
I liked searching for the steambugs in each scene
I liked the navigation by map, where you could walk to where you needed to go or just double click on the map and go directly there
There's no time limit on the game, you can take as long as you want/need.
No creepy horror or supernatural themes (like SO MANY other Artifex Mundi games, ick!)

Neutral
I like how the characters mouth and face move as they "talk" to you, but the voice acting is average.
The music fit well with the scenes and didn't jar me out of the game, but it wasn't especially memorable. If you like the music, there's an export option that gives you wma files. I'm on a Mac, so I used Switch to convert them into MP3 and they play fine.
Puzzles have a (delayed) skip option available so you're not forced to endure the puzzles unless you're collecting achievements.

Cons
I felt there were far too many puzzles and not enough hidden object scenes. (Yes, I do know that there's a skip option.) Some puzzles (the dollhouse, reflecting mirrors) were fun, and others (rolling balls, guide the pin) were just mind numbingly tedious.
And the biggest negative for me ... after all of the endless back and forth, gathering objects & boring puzzles to solve, the game just ... ends. [spoiler]Totally abruptly, you are informed that you destroyed the machine, you and Ink escape, Barber gets punished, and all is right in the world again. After all of the long journey Evangeline went through, the ending was just so jarring and abrupt. The ending cutscene just really didn't seem to fit with the story, like a sudden forced wrap up rather then a natural conclusion.[/spoiler] I would have appreciated an ending that was more satisfying and celebrated your accomplishments.

Overall I enjoyed the story, and I would recommend this game.

35666511.review:
A solidly B-class HOPA game. Not a clear Recommended, more of a Mixed.

[h1]The good:[/h1]
+ Beautiful painted art style and atmospheric music, as per usual Artifex Mundi quality
+ The usual gameplay from the genre, with nicely crafted HO scenes
+ Steampunk theme

[h1]The bad:[/h1]
- Extremely overdone German accent for the enemies' voiceovers. I'm not even German, but I felt insulted as a player by the sheer badness of it. Also heavily invokes the [url=http://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Main/GratuitousGerman]Gratuituous German[/url] trope. Plus the main enemy's logo is [i]really[/i] reminiscent of the nazi eagle. There's such a thing as overdoing a theme.
- Cheesy and banal plot with a rushed ending
- Creepy-looking facial animations. Dr. Ink constantly looked so evil to me because of it, I half-expected for him to betray the protagonist before the end of the game :P Artifex Mundi haven't quite reached their current quality of facial animations with this game yet.
- Didn't care for the animal companion. Give me something fluffy next time :P

34941754.review:
Jeder der die Vorschau und Screenshots des Spieles sieht, kann wohl erahnen, mit was für eine Art Spiel er/sie konfrontiert ist. 

Letztlich ist ein erweitertes Wimmelbild-Spiel, mit ein paar Adventure-Aspekten, in einer kleinen Geschichte mit Steampunk-Elementen, bösen Buben, einem kleinen Helfer und einem wirren Professor verpackt. Es ist ein simples Spiel, mit übersichtlichen Rästeln und einer charmanten 2D-Umsetzung. 

Es ist alles andere als ein nennenswertes Meisterwerk oder ein Unikat, sondern ein weiteres Spiel dieser Art unter vielen, welches in wenigen Stunden (ca. 3 std. Spielzeit) zu bewältigen ist. Mir ist dieses Spiel geschenkt worden, und ich habe es gerne gespielt, da mir persönlich gelegentlicher "stumpfsinn" ganz gelegen kommt. Ob es mir aber 8€ wert gewesen wäre, wage ich zu bezweifeln. 

Im Grunde macht diese Review hier keinen Sinn, aber mir ist halt langweilig. Wer Schachspiele nicht mag, wird wohl kaum irgendein Schachspiel kaufen, da es im Grundprinzip nunmal Schach bleibt, und so verhält es sich mMn auch mit diesem Wimmelbildspiel. Hinzu ist die Geschichte zwar nett, aber nichts aussergewöhnliches oder etwas, dass dieses Spiel einzigartig machen würde. Es dient nur als Mittel, um den Spieler von einem Puzzle/Such-Screen zum anderen zu führen. Letztlich macht dieses Spiel nur zu wenig falsch, um es negativ zu bewerten zu können und ist so generisch, dass es eine positive Bewertung, die Wertung innovativer und einzigartiger Spielumsetzungen herab setzen würde, die selbst jeweilige Genre-Muffel vielleicht doch begeistern würde.    
Gerade aus der letzten Überlegung heraus, und weil man gezwungen ist eine Wertung der Review an zu hängen, bewerte ich dieses Spiel negativ. Es ist nett, aber so allgemein und tausendfach reproduzierbar, dass es mir eine positive Bewertung nicht wert ist.    

*-* *-* *-* *-* *-* *-* *-* 
In Kurz:
Es ist ein Wimmelbild-Spiel mit etwas Story und ein paar Adventure-ähnlichen Rätseln. *Wuhoaaa* Diese Art Spiele müssen einen ansprechen oder halt nicht, und dann mag man das Setting und die Geschichte oder halt nicht. Wer diese Art Spiele grundsätzlich mag und den Preis bezahlen mag, macht sicherlich nichts falsch. Wer aber besonderes erwartet sollte weiter suchen.

34060669.review:
[h1][b]文末有通電(接水管)和五色球移位解謎圖分享[/b][/h1]
[h1]類型：[/h1]
點擊互動式劇情解謎
[h1]要素：[/h1]
收集品，物品組合，尋物，解謎，蒸汽龐克
[h1]中文：[/h1]
官方中文。本作翻譯大致上無問題
[h1]劇情：[/h1]
一般。劇情完整性不錯，但故事略短，屬於短篇的解謎遊戲。若能多些較刺激或令人回想的轉折會更好～例如來個回馬槍，女主角救了英克，卻讓世界陷入毀滅，或者在抓壞人的途中，機器人產生人工智慧殺了壞蛋，機器人變成最大頭目？！
[h1]畫面：[/h1]
不錯。雖然不到壁紙等級，但蒸氣龐克的畫風有充分的表現出來，還蠻不錯的！
[h1]音樂：[/h1]
不錯。音樂還蠻好聽的，旋律順耳。但種類有點少～不過這好像一直是Artifex系列的通病
[h1]難度：[/h1]
一般。本作的解謎難度前半段簡單，到拯救英克後半段時，難度有較高，但還在能解開的程度。尋物部分較為複雜，時常會看到眼睛脫窗啊，因為許多物件都是相同色調，只是外觀混在一起，有點像是保護色一樣
[h1]操作：[/h1]
簡單
[h1]優化：[/h1]
順暢
[h1] 娛樂：[/h1]
好。娛樂性在於稍短的劇情體驗加上有趣不難的小遊戲解謎+尋物解謎。遊戲畫面上，人物和場景的繪製水準有比去年(2012)的作品再更提升。以短篇解謎遊戲來說，算是不錯的作品！
[h1]重玩：[/h1]
一般。本篇完成後還附贈英克篇，非常良心。（音樂桌布都提供下載！場景桌布還不錯看）
[h1] 入手價格：[/h1]
－８０％，NT＄５８
[h1]總結：[/h1]
[u][h1][b]解謎黨推薦。劇情部分，依舊有Artifex系列的通病 "劇情略短"。但個人認為Artifex的解謎遊戲，較著重解謎成分，若故事太長，解謎會太多，玩起來會很累（若是以劇情為主的解謎則要相反，解謎少，劇情就要長些，才不會空洞）。但本作劇情內容較完整，以蒸氣龐克為要素，有著不錯的故事架構。
本作是2013年的遊戲，和2012年的Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden相比，感覺畫面已經開始有提升，不只氣氛，畫面的精細度及豐富度，都有顯著的提升。解謎部分也不難，中等難度。由於個人是剛玩完Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden，所以有兩個最大的優點改變就是，地圖可以直接傳送了，解謎及拿取物品的場景集中在同一區域了。個人玩Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden的時候，實在是非常感冒這兩個大缺點啊（沒地圖傳送，還外加物品散放各個非常遙遠的場景，遊玩時間都花在走路），本作沒有了這兩大缺點，實在是非常棒的改變！
個人是－８０％特價入手的，才NT$５８元，而且本篇玩完還附送英克篇，等於附贈ＤＬＣ...這根本佛心來的遊戲啊！若喜好解謎，又想體驗一下劇情，對於尋物解謎不排斥，個人是非常推薦本作的！[/b][/h1][/u]

[h1]缺點：[/h1]
１。起伏轉折若能在更刺激一點會更有趣，例如可以設定女主角是孤兒，在解謎的過程中，要毀滅世界的大壞蛋，竟然意外的是遺棄自己的父親?!
２。音樂可以在刺激一點，有點緩緩的啊！
[h1]３。最後的用粉筆畫六角形解謎，說明有誤。不是每個點只能點一次，是每條線只能畫一次，路線不能重複[/h1]

[h1]優點：[/h1]
１。地圖可以檢視未完成的謎題，而且最重要的是可以傳送了！省去了走來走去過場景的時間
２。有中文就是讚！
３。外篇中提供音樂及桌布下載，連小遊戲都可以先試玩XD
４。動畫和劇情結合的的還不錯，氣氛和帶入感有掌握到。解謎場景會隨劇情不斷推進。不會有之前令人詬病的重複走來走去的工具人解謎
５。本作的畫風蠻不錯的，個人喜愛

34053212.review: Nice story.  Good graphics.  Fast travel map.  Puzzles with moderate to hard diffficulties.  Extras included.  "Ink's Story" did not add much but was nice to play anyway.  Would recommend if on sale.

33916975.review:
Glass & Ink dans le titre, c'est amusant, c'est aussi les noms des deux héros du jeu. 
Evangeline Glass, que le joueur incarne, rejoint son ami le Pr Ink sur les pentes enneigées de Hochwald, au pied du château de Gerhard Barber, pour enquêter sur une mystérieuse histoire de tremblements de terre. Le maître du (haut) château se révèle être une sorte de nazi dans un genre d'univers steampunk.

Le jeu associe quelques scènes d'objets cachés avec de la recherche d'objets, quelques mini-jeux et des insectes à collecter. On évolue dans des zones restreintes qui changent avec l'évolution du scénario et étonnament ça ne pénalise pas tellement l'exploration et ça limite surtout les aller-retours. En plus, la carte permet de faire des déplacements directs. Le journal comporte la carte et une liste des objectifs mais l'un et l'autre ne sont pas nécessaires tant on ne peut pas s'égarer dans ce jeu. Les voix sont en anglais mais sous-titrées en français et tous les textes traduits.

Les graphismes proposent des dessins sympas mais avec une animation malheureusement minimale et les voix ne sont pas toujours convaincantes.  L'histoire est simpliste et anecdotique et le méchant manque d'envergure pour qu'on le prenne vraiment au sérieux. Dommage également que l'oiseau mécanique qui accompagne l'héroïne ne soit pas davantage exploité. Enfin, on peut regretter la courte durée de vie mais l'expérience de jeu est intense car on ne perd jamais de temps à tourner en rond ou à trop cogiter sur un mini-jeu.

Au final, un jeu très correct dans cette catégorie qu'on doit au studio Artifex Mundi qui est coutumier du genre.

33448219.review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is an extremely well crafted Hidden Object adventure set in a steampunk world, featuring beautiful graphics, a good soundtrack and strong voice acting. It comes with a bonus chapter that serves as a prequel to the main story.

You play an investigator trying to get to the bottom of a mysterious series of earthquakes with a side-plot of rescuing your mentor along the way. The features a variety of puzzles and the HO scenes alternate between the usual finding objects based on a list and finding objects based on their outlines.

About the only negative I had, and it's a small one, is that the puzzles although varied, were a little on the easy side.

At 3 1/2 hours to beat including the bonus chapter, if you are a fan of the HO genre, you won't be disappointed.

33125473.review:
Doktor Ink oraz jego przyjaciółka, Evangeline Glass, starają się rozwiązać tajemnicę trzęsień ziemi, które nagle pojawiły się w okolicy miasteczka Hochwald.

Po wszystkich wariacjach na temat magii, baśni, opowieści detektywistycznych byłem wielce zdziwiony, iż ktoś zdecydował się na otoczkę steampunkową. Oczywiście było to zaskoczenie jak najbardziej pozytywne, zwłaszcza że nie ograniczono się tylko do słowa, stylizacji strojów, czy jednego lub dwóch gadżetów. Grafika pełna jest szczegółów i szczególików nadających grze odpowiedniego klimatu, niezależnie od tego, czy patrzymy na golema, ulice miasteczka, łamigłówkę, czy sekwencję hidden object.

Przebieg rozgrywki nie odbiega od standardów gatunku, choć autorzy starają się żonglować patentami, by zachować jakiś stopień różnorodności. Sekwencje hidden object są zróżnicowane, ale im bliżej końca (oraz w dodatkowej miniprzygodzie), tym częściej dochodzi do parokrotnego wykorzystania tego samego obrazu. Jedna lub dwie łamigłówki sprawią, że trochę dłużej przy nich posiedzimy, ale przez pozostałe można przebić się od ręki. Dodatkowym urozmaiceniem jest mechaniczny ptak, działający jak chowaniec z Grim Legends. Z jego pomocą można zdobyć przedmioty będące poza naszym zasięgiem.

Muzyka świetnie wpasowuje się w klimat tak sytuacji, jak i przybranej konwencji steampunkowej. Niestety, montaż trochę skiepszczono. Często zdarza się, że zamiast wyciszania utwory są urywane, a następnie zamiast rozpoczęcia kolejnej ścieżki, siedzimy przez jakiś czas w ciszy. Ponadto gra zawiera nawiązania do języka niemieckiego, a aktorom zdarza się wymawiać zamienniki angielskie w dialogu.

Inną kwestią mogącą zaważyć na decyzji o zakupie jest czas gry. Główny scenariusz wraz z dodatkiem da się ukończyć w jakieś 3 godziny plus drobne. Sama w sobie Clockwork Tales to dobra gra, dająca satysfakcję, przyjemna dla oka i ucha, ale przez wzgląd na długość, pozycja raczej do zakupu w promocji. Moja ocena: 4-.

33117737.review: Das Spiel fand ich interessant, denn ich mag Rätsel und Tüfteln.

33013380.review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a quite unusal hidden object game set in a steampunk (there are industrial steam-powered machinery literally everywhere) environment and also in what seems to be a fictional version of 19th-century Prussia (which explains why some of the characters use a strange mixture of english-german language). The game is nice to look at and ticks all the right boxes for a HOG, but for me it still seemed somehow half-finished plotwise.

We play as Evangeline Glass, a special agent (who else) who receives a letter from her old mentor requesting assistance: somewhere in fictional Prussia an unnaturally large number of earthquakes shake the ground lately. According to him, these tremors occur near the village of Hochwald, so we travel there right away and quicky discover that a local tyrant/inventor, who seems to be giving orders to the military, is oppressing the locals and is behind the earthquakes. When our scientist friend is kidnapped, we must take matters into our own hands.

The game starts off good with the beautiful snowy highland area and the tense, action filled segments with the soldiers on the zeppelin. The second half though gets uninteresting pretty fast and defeating the villain (whose goals are never revealed) is underwhelming. The game is still fun though since apart from the story (almost) everything seems to be all right.

It is one of those games where we have a helper, a mechanical bird which first we have to repair to make it work again. Besides the usual fetching capability, it also has a camera function, so it can give us information about what we are up against.
In addition to the HO scenes there are fragmented object scenes as well, where we have to reassemble objects (finding missing parts). The puzzles are imaginative and plentiful, ranging from easy to some really hard ones, for example the one with the balls, where we have to roll 5 different coloured balls into their corresponding slots - not only it is hard, but tedious as well (if one of the balls gets into the wrong hole or location, we have to start it all over again).
There are 3 chapters with different looking collectibles (steam insects) for each plus a bonus chapter that precedes the main story in which we have to play as Dr. Ink, the scientist who sends for Evangeline.

The main problem is with the second half of the game in which there's hardly any action and we learn nothing about the madman's further intentions, there's no grand finale, no catharsis, we just solve puzzle after puzzle. The endgame consists of basically a simple wire puzzle. Considering our character is actually a spy, this clueless investigation and lack of resolve is especially annyoying.
I also didn't like the fact that I had to click very precisely on objects so the robot bird would interact with them. It's annoying to realise that you were on the right track, you just didn't click on the right spot and gave up the idea.

As for graphics, the game looks very good, the artwork is unique with all the snowy and steampunk environments. I also liked minor little things such as how the vision changed when I had to put on a gas mask helmet. The music is forgettable and apart from the main characters, the voice-over was terrible. I really mean it, it sounded as if they asked a few people from the studio to provide voices and they were making a feeble attempt to reproduce german accent. I think asking people from the street would have been a better idea. On the other hand the lip syncing looked surprisingly good.

So does this mean I didn't like the game? No. Would I recommend it? I would, since it does almost everything well, all the things people like hidden object games. But if you value a good storyline as much as I do, and expect to play a game that remains exciting all the way, this isn't the best HOG for you.

PROS
+ great steampunk artwork and graphics
+ lots of puzzles and fragmented object scenes
+ mechanical bird helper
+ engaging first half
+ pretty good bonus chapter

CONS
- uninteresting second half, unsatisfying finale
- some puzzles are tedious
- poor voice acting

RATING
6.5/10

32538962.review: Наверное единственная игра от Artifex Mundi ,которая не понравилась совсем. Возможно,мне просто не импонируют игры в жанре стимпанк. Не могу сказать,что игра плохая,но, если делать выбор между "рекомендую" и "не рекомендую", склоняюсь всё-таки к выбору второго варианта. Почему? Во-первых,и ,наверное,самое главное - это локализация. Даже если мы просто посмотрим на название в русской версии,то "Clockwork Tales" переведено как "Истории на время". Что,простите? Во-вторых,она мало того что совсем линейна,она,по моему мнению,явно короче ,чем любая другая игра данного разработчика. Всю игру можно разделить на три этапа. Земля-замок-подземные сооружения. Вдобавок ко второму пункту - достижения. Всего их 19. Если закрыть глаза на их русскую локализацию (из-за которой зачастую очень сложно понять,что нам нужно сделать) , часть достижений за сюжет,часть за головоломки и часть за сбор паровых жуков. Мы  даже можем пользоваться всеми подсказками. И в-третьих, возможно я просто очень далёк от данного жанра игры,но сюжет игры мне показался скучным ,концовка очень спорная. К плюсам можно отнести музыку в игре - она шикарна. Также в ней присутствует дополнительная глава,да и птичка-помощник радует глаз. Учитывая всё вышесказанное, моя оценка 6/10

31483947.review:
貌似还没有中文评测？那我来做第一个好了。
游戏不长，大概4、5个小时就可以通关。剧情还是 Artifex的一贯尿性，女主角的好友被坏人抓走，女主角前去营救。

本作难度不大，画面比较有特色，突出了发条、齿轮一类的特色。不过剧情方面就有些不合逻辑了，比如反面角色为什么要制造灾难，而看似工业革命的背景下居然出现了爱因斯坦的塑像……仿佛完全是为了这个游戏类型作出的应付剧情。

全成就很简单，因为没有“不允许使用提示”这个成就，所以在游戏过程和谜题中可以尽管使用提示。建议打两遍。第一遍休闲模式，不跳过小游戏，找物品时尽量拿到一次无失误。

这里有一个游戏流程（youtube的），如果谜题不会过的，可以看看这个：
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5cskHapprrU&t=5088s

此外找虫子的可以看看这个。本作的虫子都很大，而且都在动，所以很好找：
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=501848073

总之，这个游戏比较适合休闲放松。建议打折时购买。

31440115.review:
I received Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink as a gift from a friend. I had never played a point-and-click before, and wasn't expecting too much as I headed into the game. I figured I'd probably just be bored, with no real story or challenge to the game.

But I was pleasantly surprised!

I'm not going to rid my library of all RPGs and platformers, but I very much enjoyed Clockwork Tales. It's a very different kind of game, a quieter & more thoughtful one. Not something I'll play every night, but when I'm in the mood, it's perfect. As a matter of fact, this is the first game on Steam that I replayed to get 100% achievements, which I'm rather proud of.

The story isn't Pulitzer Prize quality, but it's entertaining and interesting enough to keep you playing. The puzzles aren't difficult, but they do require some thought at times. The graphics aren't overwhelmingly fantastic, but I enjoyed them.

Clockwork Tales was a highly enjoyable play, and I would recommend this to anyone who hasn't tried a point-and-click before, or to anyone who enjoys them.

FINAL RATING: 6/7

31297042.review: Una delle prime produzioni Artifex, ma piena di qualità. Anche se manca la lingua italiana, è comunque giocabile con soddisfazione utilizzando una delle lingue che vi sono più “affini” (io ho usato lo spagnolo). Nulla da eccepire: storia coinvolgente in stile “steampunk”, scene con oggetti nascosti facili da affrontare, mini-giochi complicati al punto giusto, filmati ben fatti, così come le musiche e le immagini. Il capitolo bonus è semplice ma comunque apprezzabile. Molto simpatica l’interazione con Matthew, un volatile meccanico che vi aiuterà in più occasioni. Complessivamente, lo consiglio. Ovviamente, per noi italiani vale la pena acquistarlo se è a un prezzo scontato…

31287930.review:
This is my first puzzle game from Artifex Mundi, & I really enjoyed it!! Clockwork Tales is a point-and-click puzzle game with a steam punk theme. The art is very beautiful, & there are lots of very fun puzzles. Only 2 of the puzzles were any challenge at all however, so if you are looking for brain-benders then you will be disappointed. The steampunk theme works great for this puzzle game, & because of this most of the puzzles felt very natural in their placement rather than shoe-horned in. There's a good balance of Hidden Object Puzzles along with the other puzzles.

The music is also beautiful, but there are only 3 tracks and it gets VERY repetitive. The game wasn't really long enough for the repetitiveness to get on my nerves however, & the puzzle music track in particular is very pretty! The voice work was also very good. 

The only thing that was a disappointment really was the story. It is a fairly simple, linear plot with no character development. There was just enough of a story to connect the puzzles & I just didn't care about Glass or Ink at all really, so it's a good thing that the puzzles were so fun!

Completing the Prologue and the main story took me 6.6 hours, but I wasn't in any rush & took my sweet time so you could probably run through it much faster if you actually focused lol. I bought this on sale at some point but I don't emember what I paid. Definitely was worth the buy for me though.

I recommend this game for someone who likes fun, creative, casual puzzle games, appreciates lovely artwork, & digs the steampunk aesthetic. Since there are no adult themes or language, & the story is simple, with the puzzles being not too challenging, I would also recommend this game for kids. :)

30641178.review:
[h1] Overview [/h1] 

Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a point and click adventure game where you play as Evangeline Glass, a women who is sent to the far off village of Hochwald on a mission to rescue your mentor, Dr. Ink, and solve the mystery of what is causing so many earthquakes to rattle the foundation of the mountain village. 

For those that have played other Artifex Mundi games, or any hidden object games in general, Clockwork Tales follows the typical game progressions; you’ll have to solve an array of puzzles ranging from painfully easy to somewhat challenging in difficulty. The puzzles probably were the strongest section of the game, combining different elements to create some genuinely interesting puzzles to overcome. However, the story, or lack thereof, and general progression of the game felt hurried and jumbled together like so many disconnected puzzle pieces; it left me wondering when the characters were going to be fleshed out and dissected or when the plot would even be marginally explained. Once the credits rolled, only then did I realize how much this title left out. Let’s review…

As Evangeline Glass, you arrive in Hochwald, a small mountainous village to meet with Dr. Ink. Shortly after your arrival, Dr. Ink is kidnapped by a giant robot  oddly reminiscent of “The Iron Giant”, and whisked away to a fortified castle own by Engineer Barber and his mechanized cronies. Here’s where I had a real issue with the game; the story consists of a thinly veiled plot that tells the reader everything, leaving nothing to be discovered. Let me explain…

The earthquakes are abnormally frequent because they [i]tell[/i] you so, the guards are corrupt because they [i]tell[/i] you so, this town isn’t what it used to be because the citizens [i]tell[/i] you that’s the case. The player doesn’t really figure out any of this for themselves; it’s all stated as fact. The worst trope that the game follows is that the soldiers are the “bad guys” so the game clads them in black, gives them a German accent and slaps on a mustache on them. Combine that all together and you've got the recipe for a generic criminal enterprise to topple.

It might sound a bit harsh, but when you factor in that the paramount points behind these types of games are the puzzles and the story, it makes a bit more sense. One without the other causes the player to lose sight of what they’re doing either due to a lack of interest of a lack of understanding. As mentioned above, the puzzles are the game’s strong suit, while the plot is the weakest portion of the game and ultimately why I cannot recommend it.

For those not interested in plot spoilers or have already played the game, when Dr. Ink is inconspicuously kidnapped by Engineer Barber's 50ft robot in the middle of town and nobody seems to notice but you, you’re tasked with saving him. You dawn a soldier’s Wolfenstein-styled uniform, barter for a helmet, board a zeppelin, repair a mechanical glider out of a box of scrap, infiltrate the castle, defeat a few robots to save Dr. Ink and disable Engineer Barber’s machine with some blueprints, a piece of chalk and a hexagon, thus ending the game. 

The only parcel of information that is revealed at the end of the game is that the machine Engineer Barber controls was created by his father, who constructed it to [i]prevent[/i] earthquakes from occurring. However, it has been reverse engineered to produce them instead; the reason for this never being explained. Then again, the backstory in its entirety is never explained. We’re not told who Dr. Ink is, how he discovered this place, why he cares, who Engineer Barber’s father is or why this contraption exists in the first place. At the end of the game, you simply disable, not destroy, the earthquake machine and leave Engineer Barber alone to simply rebuild and continue his work. There’s seemingly nothing stopping him from fixing the damage, firing some security personnel and investing in a gun to put you down the next time you crash land in his courtyard. The plot is just an intangible mess from beginning to end. 


[h1] Pros [/h1] 

[list]
[*] Some of the puzzles are actually quite tricky. 
[*] The artwork, layout and general theme of the game is well done. 
[*] No bugs, glitches or progression issues were experienced during gameplay.
[/list]

[h1] Cons [/h1] 

[list] 
[*] The story is short and much of it is left unexplained.
[*] The voice acting is dreadful. I clicked on the old lady constantly in the tavern just to laugh and annoy my husband.
[*] The characters are very two-dimensional [personality].
[/list]


Overall, Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is just one of many hidden object games on Steam. There are better ones out there, several from the same developer and I’d suggest taking the time to look into those instead. With forgettable characters, atrocious voice acting and a subpar plot. If you enjoy hidden object games, I’d suggest looking elsewhere.

30340174.review:
Если в «Бездне: Духи Эдема» Artifex Mundi предложили нам головоломочную версию Биошока, то в Clockwork Tales перед нами ненапряжный стимпанк-point’n’click квест-версия Dishonored. Шучу. Наверное. 

По сюжету нам достается в протагонисты восторженная барышня, которая наглоталась барбитуратов и решила, что она профессиональная шпионка. А тут ей как раз местный Дамблдор из местного Хогвардса письмо написал, мол, помоги, фашисткие хулиганы зрения лишают, механических птиц ломают и не дают торговать алкоголем после 20:00. Барышня приехала, навела шороху, сломала отель, починила кукольный дом и помешала главному злодею захватить мир с помощью землетрясительной машины. 

{Все этой такой отборный бред, что никто даже не воткнет, что я сечас выдал жесточайший спойлер}. 

Гласс с ним, с сюжетом. Что запишем в графе «Итого»? А вот что. Это, конечно, не Syberia, но это больше, чем просто нарядная казуалка.  Правда, по качеству картинки она весьма неоднородна. То видно, что вся графика нарисована с любовью, то попадается раздражающая глаз откровенная халтура. 

Лицевая анимация тут тоже неоднозначная. Если у доктора Инка она выглядит прекрасно, то у других персонажей как-то не очень. Девочка с ее песенкой про котенка будет еще долго вам снится в кошмарах, поверьте.
 
Уж не знаю, кто занимался локализацией этой поделки, но получилось тоже так себе. Ошибки в переводе не критичные, но досадные. Чернильница вместо чернильного пятна, зерно вместо кукурузы, сито вместо дуршлага, стаканы вместо бокалов, труба вместо курительной трубки – это лишь малая часть допущенных огрехов, которые, мягко говоря, в поисках предметов не помогают. 

Зато здесь есть легко выбиваемые ачивки и карточки. Мелочь, а приятно. Да в целом послевкусие недурное. Тем, кто еще только открывает для себя подобные игры - советую. Искушенным игрокам - Clockwork Tales, скорее всего, покажется очень вторичной и слишком легкой.

Ein weiteres Meisterstück des Entwicklers Artifex Mundi, der uns erst kürzlich mit der hervorragenden Fortsetzung von „Nightmares from the Deep“ erfreut hat! Nur dass der Schauplatz diesmal nicht die Karibik ist, sondern die Schweizer Alpen…
Die Grafik ist wirklich wunderbar und kreativ gezeichnet, die Zwischensequenzen und die Charaktere sehr gut animiert. Ja, wir müssen uns auch mit dem ein oder anderen unterhalten, das ist aber sehr kurzweilig und stellenweise sehr lustig!! Vor allem das englisch mit deutschem Akzent (natürlich mit deutschen Untertiteln) ist sehr gelungen.
Fakten: 3 Schwierigkeitsgrade wählbar, 9 Kapitel plus Bonus-Kapitel, das Inventar lässt sich feststellen, der Tipp ist richtungsweisend, eine Karte zeigt uns wo etwas auf Erledigung wartet und transportiert uns schnell dorthin, das Lösungsbuch folgt nicht unserem Fortschritt, ein mechanischer Rabe ist unser Helfer um an höher Gelegenes zu kommen.
Gezählt habe ich 13 Wimmelbilder unterschiedlicher Art: Suche nach abgebildeten Fragmenten, Suche nach vorgegebenen Silhouetten, Dinge suchen und wieder passend ins Bild einsetzen, und leicht interaktive nach Liste. Noch mehr Minispiele (gezählte 25) sind zu lösen, die meisten sind altbekannt und „neu verpackt“, wie z. B. Schiebepuzzle, Ringe rotieren bis ein Muster entsteht, alle Lampen auf rot stellen, Rezepte ausführen, alle Linien nur einmal benutzen usw … Allesamt gut zu lösen!

29167198.review:
Tylko jedna osoba może powstrzymać nadchodzącą katastrofę, jest nią Ewangelina Glass, a my pomożemy jej rozwikłać wielką tajemnicę.

[h1]OPRAWA[/h1]
Piękne, ręcznie rysowane lokacje sprawiają, że Clockwork Tales ma niesamowity urok, po pierwsze kolorystyka jest bardzo przyjemna dla oka, a po drugie widać ogromną ilość pracy, którą włożono w tę grę. Każde odwiedzane przez nas miejsce jest szczegółowo dopracowane. Oświetlenie jest idealnie dobrane, ponieważ potrafi stworzyć tajemniczą atmosferę bez wlewania mroku w każdy zakamarek. Animacje postaci są bardzo dobrze zrobione, przez co możemy polubić spotkane na drodze osobistości. Oprawa dźwiękowa jest przyjemna dla ucha dzięki czemu mocniej zagłębiamy się w świat gry, a dźwięki przyrody sprawiają, że możemy odstresować się po długim dniu w pracy lub szkole. Głosy naszych rozmówców są bardzo dobrze dobrane dzięki czemu możemy odczuć towarzyszące im emocje. 

[h1]FABUŁA[/h1]
Trafiamy do pewnego miasteczka położonego między ośnieżonymi szczytami. Sprowadza nas genialny doktor Ink, który niedługo po naszym przybyciu znika w tajemniczych okolicznościach. Od tej chwili naszym celem jest odnalezienie geniusza oraz odkrycie przyczyn potężnych trzęsień ziemi. Znajdujemy się w czasach parowej rewolucji, więc jak sama nazwa wskazuje napotkamy na swojej drodze wiele maszyn, między innymi naszego małego pomocnika Mateusza, który pomoże nam w sytuacjach gdzie sami nie dalibyśmy sobie rady. 

[h1]ROZGRYWKA[/h1]
Odkrywając kolejne części tajemnicy ciążącej nad miasteczkiem trafimy na wiele łamigłówek o zróżnicowanym stopniu trudności oraz scen z ukrytymi obiektami, w których będziemy musieli wykazać się dużą spostrzegawczością. Zdobyte wcześniej przedmioty musimy wykorzystać w odpowiednich do tego miejscach co zwiększy również naszą kreatywność, ponieważ rozwiązania nie są zawsze takie oczywiste. Kolekcjonerzy będą mogli znaleźć 30 mechanicznych robaczków.

[h1]PODSUMOWUJĄC[/h1]
Szczegółowo dopracowane lokacje są dowodem na to, że twórcy włożyli naprawdę dużo pracy w tą odsłonę. Relaksujące udźwiękowienie oraz śliczna oprawa graficzna tworzą cudowny klimat. Ciekawa opowieść wciągnie nas na dobre kilka godzin. 

[h1]DLA TYCH, KTÓZY NIE LUBIĄ CZYTAĆ[/h1]
+ Śliczna oprawa graficzna
+ Relaksujące udźwiękowienie
+ Wciągająca opowieść
+ Przedmioty kolekcjonerskie
+ Osiągnięcia steam
+ Dodatkowa przygoda
+ Polski produkt

Jeżeli moja recenzja pomogła Ci przy podjęciu decyzji nad zakupem, będę wdzięczny jeśli ją ocenisz/skomentujesz, co jest dla mnie ogromną motywacją do pracy nad kolejnymi tekstami.

28714848.review:
Solides Wimmelbildspiel im Steampunk-Look!

Natürlich sollte man bei einem WBS seine Erwartungen allgemein ein bisschen herunterschrauben: Die wenigsten WBS warten mit packender Geschichte, High-End-Grafik und ewig langem Spielvergnügen auf. Aber "Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink" erfüllt meine Genre-Erwartungen völlig:

+ zeitgemäße Grafik mit kleineren Videosequenzen und Animationen
+ abwechslungsreiche Rätsel, u. a. klassisches WBS, Drähte verbinden, Bilder aus Scheiben zusammendrehen, Puzzles, kleinere Logikrätsel, ...
+ atmosphärische Steampunk-Rätsel, z. B. Zahnradmechanismen reparieren, Erfinderporträts ihren Erfindungen zuordnen, Gleitflügel und mechanische Vögel bauen
+ teils witzige Dialoge
+ nette Musik
+ Musik und Wallpaper problemlos speicherbar

= Geschichte fesselt nicht
= blasse Charaktere
= Bonuskapitel ist sehr kurz geraten
= Gesamtspielzeit von etwa 4 Stunden
= meist logisch aufgebaut
= letzte Errungenschaft [spoiler] schafft man nur, wenn man von Anfang an auf "schwer" oder das Spiel noch einmal spielt [/spoiler]

- teilweise ZU stereotyp (böses Militär mit deutschem Akzent, fast alle Steampunk-Stereotypen eingebaut)
- WBS tauchen teilweise an komischen Orten in der Geschichte auf
- die Suche nach den mechanischen Käfern ist zu einfach

Insgesamt ist das Spiel für Gelegenheitsspieler und eher pazifistische Steampunkfans zu empfehlen.

28421960.review:
+ Beautiful Art
+ Solid music
+ Some puzzles are fairly original
+ Good hint system

- Boring writing
- Very low difficulty for puzzles
- Some puzzles are poorly explained
- Weird character animation

I do like hidden object games—The Tiny Bang Story, for example—but this one was a touch too far on the easy side, to the point where many of the puzzles felt like busywork. The hidden object segments were easy to the point you could just click randomly on objects that stood out and it was usually something you were supposed to be finding anyway.

I was also expecting too much from the writing based on the descriptions and other reviews. The few characters you meet and talk to are just plot devices. It's worth mentioning the way they're animated gets into serious uncanny valley territory at times, too. Their faces move and warp while the rest of their body remains perfectly still, which takes some getting used to. The storyline turned out to be just an excuse plot (an evil man has a machine that he uses to create earthquakes, because...well, just because). The world has a few interesting details, like having patron saints for different scientific advancements, but the steampunk here was really more of an aesthetic than anything.

I can easily imagine others enjoying this, so if you're just looking for a pretty world with lots of soothingly easy puzzles to tinker with, by all means pick this game up. It would also be great for young kids. I'm afraid it just wasn't for me.

26298609.review: Wieder mal ein richtig gutes Spiel von Artifex Mundi. Noch dazu mal ein ungewohnt kniffliges. Teilweise sogar seeehr knifflig. Ich kann jedem, der auf diese Art von Spielen steht, dieses hier nur empfehlen. Die Entwickler verstehen ihr Handwerk und sie haben es hier meiner Meinung nach wieder mal sehr gut umgesetzt. Wenn man überhaupt ein Manko finden wollte, wären es einzig die Dialoge der unwichtigen Nebenpersonen. Bei mehreren hört man raus, dass es deutsche sind, die der englischen Sprache nicht wirklich mächtig sind. Das tut dem Spielspaß aber für mich absolut nichts negatives. Von mir eine absolute Empfehlung für jeden, der auf Wimmelbild / Point&Klick / Rätsel-Minigames steht. Ich hab für den ersten Durchlauf inkl. Bonuslevel ca 5h benötigt und ich werd es auf jeden Fall nochmal durchspielen, um alle Achievements zu erhalten. Danke an die Entwickler... macht weiter so :)

25840588.review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink ist ein Hidden Objekt Spiel von Artifex Mundi.
Man schlüpft in die Rolle von Evangeline Glass die von ihrem alten Freund Dr. Ink um Hilfe gebeten wurde eine Reihe von Erdbeben zu untersuchen, doch schon kurz nach der Ankunft unserer Heldin wird der gute Doktor entführt und so macht man sich nicht nur auf den Weg um die Ursache der Erdbeben ausfindig zu machen sondern auch Ink zu befreien. Angesiedelt ist das ganze in einer Steampunk-Welt die ich sehr ansprechend fand. Ansonsten ist aber vieles in der Story sehr vorhersehbar.
Das Gameplay ist sehr Genretypisch, man bewegt die Heldin von Hintergrund zu Hintergrund, hält nach Objekten ausschau mit denen man etwas anfangen kann, sucht sich durch Wimmelbilder und löst hin und wieder ein Rätsel. Der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist dabei durchwachsen, es gibt einige sehr leichte und einige etwas schwerere Rätsel, alle sind jedoch mit etwas überlegen gut lösbar. Für die etwas fauleren Spieler gibt es natürlich auch eine Hinweis Option und die Möglichkeit Rätsel zu überspringen. Abseits davon gibt es noch eine kleine Nebenaufgabe, die darin besteht Käfer zu finden, wobei jeder Hintergrund genau einen Käfer besitzt. 
Grafisch gehört das Spiel zu den besten Spielen von Artifex Mundi. Die Figuren sehen schon ziemlich gut aus und die Hintergründe und vor allem die Wimmelbilder sind sehr detailreich.
Auch der Sound ist in diesem Spiel sehr gelungen. Die Charaktere wurden anständig vertont und die Musik dudelt angenehm im Hintergrund vor sich her.
Insgesamt das beste Spiel von Artifex, dass mir bisher in die Finger geraten ist. Freunde dieses Entwicklerteams sowie Genrefans können hier beruhigt zuschlagen, zumindest wenn es im Sale mal für unter 5 Euro zu kriegen ist. Die Spielzeit beträgt übrigens 3 - 5h (mit Bonuskapitel kommt maximal noch eine weitere Stunde hinzu).

故事发生在一个蒸汽朋克的背景下，有个丧心病狂的博士研究了一个地震机器，主角和他的老师要去破坏该机器的故事。看我用一句话就能概括这个简单的剧情，可以说平淡无奇。

本作由于发行时间早，所以制作水平上有限，过场动画都是2D，相比Artifex近两年3D化的视觉效果来看显得有些成成旧。

在游戏性上保持了Artifiex社一贯的游戏方式，基本便是不断地到处找东西。那让我讨厌的“找你妹”小游戏也遍布游戏各个阶段，我之所以讨厌这个小游戏是因为这个小游戏显得毫无道理，明明可以自己从一堆杂物中找到有用的非要先找些不相干的。相比之下其他的一些益智小游戏更为有趣，不过如果玩过很多A社的游戏的话还是会觉得有些重复。不过玩过很多的话也不会无聊来看评论的啦~\(≧▽≦)/~

25099727.review:
Game Mechanics:
The game focuses mainly on logic puzzles and hidden object scenes. Both are pretty decent in their complexity and their difficulty. The main objective of the game is usually to find a specific item in these scenes or acquire passage or entry into a certain area.

Plot:
The plot is relatively thin, it is of the "villain-has-doomsday-device-and-must-be-stopped"-variety. Though this doesn't detract from the enjoyment of the game, as it is sort of only there as an excuse to link the hidden-object-scenes and puzzles together.

Presentation:
Everything is portrayed in a steampunk way and the game is consistent in its display of this genre. The art used in the puzzles is a bit lackluster at times, but the hidden object scenes are very nicely designed. Another point I'd like to bring up is the above-average voice acting for this sort of game.

Completion:
If you're into casual puzzlers or hidden-object-games, go for it. If you're just looking for an enjoyable string of puzzles, also go for it. The achievements aren't very difficult to obtain (especially if you first do a an easy and then an expert play-through).

I especially liked the saints in the church in the prequel.  I give this game 7 out of 10.  Buy it when it is on sale and you won't regret it if you like puzzle games - definitely worth the money.

24904330.review:
Истории на время:  Рассказаные Гласс и Инком - замечательный "поиск скрытых предметов" в стилистике парапанка, от польских камрадов.

1) [u]Сюжет[/u]: шпионка Евангелина Гласс отправляется на встречу со своим другом и наставником профессором Инком в далекую горную деревню Хохвальд. Привел туда наших героев ряд землетрясений вокруг данной деревни. Сюжет проведет нашу героиню через череду событий которые откроют связь землетрясений, местной машины судного дня, и потомственного правителя данных мест - генерал-инженера Барбера. Сюжет прописан очень хорошо и интересно, единственный минус пожалуй - это косяки в некоторых местах с русским переводом, впрочем это видно уже по русскому названию.

2) [u]Геймплей[/u]: игровой процесс аналогичен другим играм данного жанра, нововведение здесь только в механической птичке, которая может доставать предметы недоступные нашей героине. Соотношение паззлов и поиска "скрытых предметов" примерно один к одному. Сама игра и паззлы в ней очень легкие, и без напряга проходятся на максимальной сложности (сложностей всего 3, и разнятся они наличием подсказок на карте, и скоростью активации пропусков и подсказок). После прохождения основного сюжета, откроется дополнительный эпизод с приквелом, в котором рассказывается о том как доктор Инк нашел свою цель в начале сюжета. В разделе "дополнительное" можно будет перепройти все паззлы и сцены поиска, а также скачать обои на рабочий стол и музыку.

3) [u]Графика и звуки[/u]: картинка в игре сделана в очень хорошем стимпанковском стиле, любителям оного должно понравиться. Есть качественные видеовставки. Музыка приятная, плюс есть хорошая английская озвучка.

[u]Как итог[/u]: еще одна замечательная игра от Artifex Mundi. Любителям жанра "поиска скрытых предметов", парапанка, собирания "идеальных игр" в профиль, да и просто хороших сюжетных игр, рекомендую!
8 механических птичек из 10.

Avventura grafica "casual" discreta con ottime illustrazioni e musiche, meno le animazioni spesso appena abbozzate. Enigmi semplici accompagnati da un buon numero di mini-giochi e sezioni "hidden object", queste ultime forse piuttusto ripetetive. La trama promette bene ma si conclude con un finale raffazzonato, come se gli sviluppatori fossero andati fuori tempo massimo e avessero dovuto concludere il gioco in un modo o nell'altro. Piacevole il "bonus" costituito da un mini prequel accessibile solo dopo aver concluso l'avventura principale.
In generale un buon rappresentate della categoria delle avventure grafiche punta & clicca facili facili. La possibilità di ottenre indizi e impostare il livello di difficoltà la rende davvero per tutti ma i puristi del genere è bene che ne stiano alla larga, consiglio valido per qualsiasi gioco appartenente a questa categoria.

24669608.review:
The makers of Grim Legends do it again with yet another lovely Hidden Object game. Released in 2013, Artifex Mundi’s Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is not one of their earlier games… and yet, it kind of plays like one. 
Clockwork Tales is an adventure/hidden object game. If you’ve never played one of those, Artifex Mundi’s are, in my opinion, some of the best you could pick to play. Their dedication to making the games visually stunning and the stories compelling is quite amazing, and they’ve been known to listen to the community and improve on their games. That said, it’s still a far from perfect game, and it was one of my slightly least favorite ones from them. 
In Clockwork Tales you play as Evangeline Glass, a spy of sorts, a special agent working with Intelligence, who goes in the search of her friend, who had disappeared while on the field, working to find out what was causing some mysterious earthquakes. Like in most hidden object games, the story is nothing overly special, but I did like the touch of it being set in a steampunk world, as I feel we’re severely lacking in variation for themes. I do wish the story was slightly less formulaic though, and not just with Artifex Mundi’s game, but with Hidden Objects one in general: Person disappears, other person goes fetch, illogical things happen, evil is shown, evil is defeated. 
I don’t want to spoil the ending, but I was rather disappointed with it. There is advice in writing that says, “Show, don’t tell.” This is especially true of visual media such as videogames. The ending, then, failed this advice. It felt like it came to an abrupt halt, followed by a long winded expositionby Evangeline that didn’t explain anything of what was left unexplained, but that let us know that the bad guy sure got what he deserved! How? Why? We might never know. 
As far as the technical aspect goes, it plays fairly smoothly. 
You have “steambugs” as collectable items. What was a bit different from their other games here was that, while in most games you have x goal amount for the whole game, this one was a goal amount per area. They were also far more noticeable than in other games, which made them quite easy to find. 
The art is decent, though as usual in their older games, some of the characters can look a bit creepy in some of the scenes when the body is drawn oddly. The backgrounds are detailed and gorgeous like in all their games - one of their strongest points. 
Another thing I liked was the use of the pet (a steam-pet this time) to fetch and manipulate items, record movies and sound, etc. The usage of the pet system as more than just something to “fetch” items was a breath of fresh air, and I hope they will use it in more of their games. 

The access to the map was just a bit more annoying than usual, for you have to go into the notebook each time as opposed to directly clicking on the map; plus, each time you fast travel, the map doesn’t close itself. It’s nitpicking a little, I know, but I got used to the ease with which later games handled the map ad fast traveling. 

Clockwork Tales is also a little ‘harder’ in the logic department. Most the hidden object games follow some rather weird logic at times. Say for instance (not a scene taken from the game, mind you, just for illustration purposes on what I mean) you have a pile of ash, and something underneath it. In real life you could use your hands, or whatever item lays close by, to poke and sift through the ash. In a normal hidden object game you’d want some kind of brush, or cloth, or broom, even if you have a perfectly acceptable item for the job nearby. In Clockwork tales, you’d probably have to climb up a flagpole to rip down a flag to then find scissors to cut a piece from it so you can use it on the ash. What? That perfectly acceptable piece of cloth right next to the pile of ash? Oh, we can’t use that!

Later games of Artifex Mundi allow you to skip items on hidden object scenes, or skip the scenes all together, by playing a game of mahjong. Not here. I was sad to be unable to switch it up and play a bit of Mah Jong now and then. 

Another thing I wasn’t as fond of, but this one was more due to personal preference rather than a fault with the game, was that the mini-games were a lot more often the switch and slide games, or the ones were pressing something requires you to do it in the exact order. It was like they had picked all the mini-games I like the least to put them in here. If you do like those games, however, then you will definitely have a better time playing this one than I did!

Lastly, I found a small bug where my inventory would get stuck at the bottom when I finished some puzzles and returned to normal view, which required me to exit and enter the game again to unlock. Not game breaking, but annoying.

Would I recommend it? Yes. Despite the downsides, I had fun playing it. 
There are far worse hidden object games around, but there are also better ones from Artifex Mundi itself.

24623044.review:
I was in the mood for an adventure game recently but wanted to play something relaxing rather than like a psychological horror. Then I remembered I had a key for this game from some Humble Bundle a long time ago.

I'll get straight to the gist of things. Clockwork Tales has a target audience, most likely kids or people who don't normally play video games. If you're in that target audience, it's a good buy. If you're not, it probably isn't. I'm still leaving a positive review because in and of itself it's a decent game, it's just that it might not be for you.

Since this was my first time playing a hidden objects game, I can't really comment on the quality of the puzzles. (They were for the most part either “find all the hidden objects” or sort of abstract logic puzzles; traditional “combine this item with that item” challenges were relatively rare.) I can say that they were all rather easy ― with one exception towards the end ― and unfortunately left me feeling unchallenged.

From a technical standpoint, I was actually surprised by production values shown here ― definitely was not expecting cutscenes or talking animations (though the latter were sort of creepy). The game looks beautiful, with really great art everywhere. The music is also fine, although it repeats a bit too much. Story-wise it is inoffensive, albeit not particularly good ― something on the level of an average cartoon.

Overall, it took me 5 hours to complete both the basic game and the bonus prequel adventure (which was a little lower quality than the original). However, you may want to replay the game after completion if you didn't get all the secrets the first time around. There's also an extras section in the menu, which allows you to replay all the minigames.

[h1]- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------[/h1]

This is one of my favorite Artifex Mundi game even that one is shorter than some I've played before.

Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink takes place in a steam(punk) world where a continuing string of strange earthquakes are causing the world’s cities to crumble to ruin. You play as Evangeline a friend and confident of Dr. Ambrose Ink. The latter asked Evangeline to come to Hochwald and help him out in order to stop the General Engineer of Gottland evil plans and the tremors for good. The bonus story let you play as Dr Ambrose Ink before the Agent Evangeline visit him.

The story and voices are good and graphics as well as music are very good. Puzzles and hidden objects scenes are fairly shared.

The game features an inventory where you can store items to combine with the environment to go deeper in the story as well as a showcase for steam bugs found in each area. In that game you'll have a steam bird as a fellow which will help you to reach things you can't.

The game have several difficulties and have a guest feature : all the family can play the game and resume it where they left. There is also a map which is useful when you're lost and that may have some hints if you play in a easier mode. Also you can use the Hint/Skip hourglass whenever you want and wait until its refill to use it again. But be warned that you may not skip or use a hint in any puzzle or hidden objects scene if you wish to have some achievements.

There is a good choice of puzzles and there are two kind of Hidden objects scenes. The first Hidden objects scene features the name of the objects to find some are found easily (normal one) and some others need you to interact with the environment or to combine two items to found them. The second Hidden objects scene let you find the shape of the objects in the scene and sometimes ask you to combine them with the environment.

(#) :
The game has some achievements that can be missed which are challenging achievements and a difficulty related one. The difficulty achievement asks you to play the game in Expert mode. Challenging achievements require you to finish a puzzle or a hidden objects scene under one minute. You also need to solve every puzzle and hidden objects scene without skipping or using hints. Another achievement requires you to find 3 objects in 3 seconds or find all objects with only 5 or fewer misclicks in the hidden object scenes. Also the steam bugs can be missed if you moved to earlier in a new area but you can still follow a guide on steam to make sure it never happens even if you'll most likely find them easily on your own. Another easy but missable achievement is "People Person" which requires you to talk to everyone before and after Dr vanished. Finally another achievement requires you to complete the bonus story.

23730266.review:
You can't go wrong with steampunk unless you really try, but then again you can't always go right with it, which I think is the case with [i]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i].  All of the necessary elements are here: sweeping fantasy, maniac evildoers, pipes and leathers and conspicuous gearing, airships and monocles and florid facial hair, evil robots and mechanical tinkery.  What's missing is the kind of lucid, engrossing gameplay I like to see from Artifex Mundi. Instead, this game feels forced and vague. 

It's not bad. I just like my Artifex games to stand tall over the competition, and this one is more of a shoulder-to-shoulder proposition. I hit all of the achievements here in a single play-through, and didn't find much in the way of detail and nuance. The various mechanical insects to spot and collect are barely concealed at all, the hidden object scenes are pretty but blunt, and the mini-games are on the bland, simple side. The main challenges are pretty much announced as flat tasks - "I need to paint this room blue before I'll be allowed to leave," that sort of thing. "Where have I seen blue paint? Maybe I should make some." I don't necessarily love game-stopping difficulty levels, but slipping too far in the other direction doesn't make for engaging play.  

Maybe I'm just burning out on the genre; certainly most HOGs are cast from similar molds, and perhaps I'm just overwhelmed by the constant selection of games right now. Recommended, because it's good - but this is one to play on the way to a better one.

22853381.review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink to przygodowa gra z gatunku Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure, stworzona przez specjalizujące się w produkcjach tego typu polskie studio Artifex Mundi. Tytuł przenosi nas do górskiego miasteczka Hochwald. Wcielając się w agentkę wywiadu, Ewangelinę Glass, musimy rozwiązać zagadkę zaginięcia doktora Inka. Ostatnią sprawą, którą się zajmował, były niezwykle silne trzęsienia ziemi, niszczące miasta. Jego zdaniem za ich powstaniem nie stały siły natury, a człowiek. Podążając tropem zaprzyjaźnionego naukowca, bohaterka dociera do bram zamczyska Gerharda Berbera, Generała Inżyniera całej krainy Gottlandii.

Gry z gatunku HOPA, ze względu na swój prosty i spokojny model rozgrywki, często mają problemy z zachowaniem spójności i logiki w swoich fabułach, szczególnie gdy występują w nich momenty akcji. Jednak twórcy z polskiego studia stanęli na wysokości zadania i stworzyli ciekawą, trzymającą poziom do samego końca, szpiegowską opowieść, którą poznaje się po prostu przyjemnie. Smaku dodaje wyraźnie zarysowany, steampunkowy klimat. Cieszyć nim możemy się dzięki świetnie wyglądającej oprawie wizualnej. Nie obraziłbym się za nieco płynniejsze i bardziej realistyczne animacje postaci, ale i tak jest dobrze.

Pod względem rozgrywki produkcja prezentuje również wysoki poziom. W sumie jest to typowa HOPA, czyli ukazana z pierwszej osoby klikana przygodówka, polegająca na odpowiednim wykorzystywaniu posiadanych przedmiotów oraz rozwiązywaniu minigier. Te zaś można podzielić na typowe łamigłówki logiczne i sekwencje hidden object, które w tym przypadku zasługują na pewne wyróżnienie. W większości podobnych gier owe sekwencje object ograniczają się do zatłoczonych scen, w których gracz ma za zadanie wskazać wypisane poniżej przedmioty. W Clockwork Tales takich sekwencji oczywiście nie brakuje, ale są one w pewien sposób urozmaicone. Niektóre sceny na przykład wymagają od gracza odnajdywania przedmiotów w odpowiedniej kolejności i wykorzystywania ich do zdobycia kolejnych. Inne za to każą nam odnajdywać obiekty o narysowanym poniżej kształcie pośród porozrzucanych części tego samego typu. Może brzmi to jak mało znaczący szczegół, ale w grach tego typu, o dość powtarzalnej rozgrywce, takie szczegóły się liczą i wpływają pozytywnie na odbiór całej produkcji. Warto zaznaczyć, że Clockwork Tales to produkcja casualowa. Jest stosunkowo prosta, a do tego można podczas jej przechodzenia skorzystać z licznych podpowiedzi i ułatwień. Dla bardziej wymagających graczy przygotowano tryb eksperta, pozwalający nieco podnieść poprzeczkę.

Podsumowując, Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink to naprawdę dobra HOPA, która na swój sposób pokazuje, iż nasze rodzime studio nie ma sobie równych w tworzeniu gier tego typu. Nie jest to oczywiście najlepsza produkcja, w jaką przyszło mi grać, ale te ponad trzy godziny, które z nią spędziłem, wspominam bardzo przyjemnie i praktycznie niczego temu tytułowi zarzucić nie mogę. Fani gatunku zdecydowanie powinni po niego sięgnąć.

- Great voice-overs (well above par for this whole genre, IMO). All of them except for one particular peasant in one particular (and very brief) scene, anyway.

- nice animations, in particular those of people speaking. Nicely done.

- music... i can't remember it, which means it didn't get on my nerves. That counts as a plus.

- i appreciate the "collectibles" (the Steambugs), though i am not OCD enough to lose any sleep if i happen to miss any of them.

- _One_ complaint (again... i feel like a broken record...): ambiguous terms in HO scenes are a real drag. In the kitchen, you've got to find a "pot." There are _four_ of them in the HO scene. Four pots. At least (i stopped counting at four). There's also an ambiguous "ring" in one scene (with 3 rings in it: one keyring and two finger rings). Come on, devs! Use Google Images to double-check!!!

- So far well within a tolerable "what the HELL just happened?" ratio (specifically, the owl and the snowball is the only one which comes to mind). HOPAs with too many of those go in my trash can.

i've gotta thumb-up this one.

Ich habe das Spiel auf "Schwer" durchgespielt - Die Rätsel empfand ich dabei im Vergleich zu anderen Wimmelbildspielen schwerer. Für meinen Geschmack hätte es im Hauptspiel ein paar Wimmelbildszenen mehr geben können, aber das ist hier wirklich nicht weiter schlimm. Im Bonuskapitel gibts dann noch genügend Wimmelbildszenen. Das Spiel selbst ist stark storylastig und ziemlich atmosphärisch (wenn man mal die übertriebenen Akzente mancher Sprecher weglässt^^), man hat hier wirklich das Gefühl, auf die Lösung des Falls hinzuarbeiten. Für mich eins der besseren Wimmelbildspiele.

22025107.review:
On peut reprocher, entre autres choses, à certains jeux Artifex Mundi d'être trop génériques, d'avoir l'inspiration fade. En signant l'adaptation d'un roman polonais que personne n'a lu, les maîtres du jeu d'objets cachés ont mis leur vice entre parenthèses le temps d'une aventure au royaume du steampunk, du simili-cuir, des dorures qui ont l'air plus luxueuse qu'elles ne le sont, le royaume de la rouille, du jaune, du rouge et de l'orange. Réservez votre après-midi, annulez votre dîner aux chandelles avec Naomi Watts et piquez-vous la veine d'un vaccin contre le tétanos. Vous embarquez pour l'Occident Express, direction plein Nord.

Clockwork Tales est superbe ; chaque écran de jeu s'ouvre comme une fenêtre sur un autre monde, un continent froid tyrannisé par des nazillons en costume où l'on croise des automates en cuivre. Vous posez pied à terre à Hochwald, une bourgade glaciale où les hommes s'emmitouflent dans des fourrures aux relans marrons, tous attirés par le chaud d'une auberge où il fait bon renifler la fumée d'un café. Dehors, la surface est recouverte d'un manteau de neige peuplé de lumières bouillantes.

Lancé à la poursuite d'une espèce de Mengele inoffensif, on recouvre le sol de nos va-et-vient. Mais parce qu'il est facile, Clockwork Tales ne frustrera pas même votre grande tante malvoyante ou votre adolescent de cousin qui ne sait qu'écraser les piétons d'un GTA - pas même en mode expert. Mieux rythmé que d'autres jeux de sa gamme, [i]Of Glass and Ink[/i] a la saveur d'un jeu d'aventure classique ; on passe plus de temps à explorer son monde et à y résoudre des énigmes qu'à chasser les objets planqués. De temps en temps, on s'arrête et débusque les quelques pixels qui veulent jouer à cache-cache, puis on reprend la direction de cette encoche dans laquelle on voulait fourrer un emblème. La faiblesse du scénario, comme trop souvent simple prétexte au voyage, est contrebalancée par un découpage de notre progression qui rappelle les ''vrais'' point & click. Les péripéties nous font aller de l'avant et nous empêchent de revenir sur nos pas, alors on avance, poussé au cul par les aléas du chemin jusqu'à ce château où patrouillent des golems de métal, jusqu'à ces sous-sols volcaniques aux ventres rouges. Une poignée d'heures plus loin, on quitte l'écran d'ordinateur des couleurs plein la tête. Alors on revient dans un corps qui a faim et soif, la peau parcourue de chair de poule, encore convaincu d'avoir voyagé loin.

21404144.review:
[h1] Этот обзор - моё личное мнение![/h1]

[h1]ОПИСАНИЕ[/h1]

Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink - это игра в жанре "поиск предметов", в стимпанковской стилистике. Игра повествует нам о том, как в одном непреметном городке начали происходить землетрясения, которые никак не связаны с природой. Наша главная героиня - Евангелина, приезжает в город по просьбе своего друга - Инка, но как только мы начинаем играть, его тут же похищают. И вот на протежении всей игры мы будем искать Инка и бороться со злым учёным.

 [h1]ПЛЮСЫ[/h1]

- Красивая графика.
- Механическая птичка, которая разнообразит геймплей.
- Приятная музыка.
- Очень лёгкие достижения.

[h1]МИНУСЫ[/h1]

- Локализация просто ужасна.
- Сильно различается разница в сложности головоломок.
- Продолжительнось. ( хотя все игры в этом жанре короткие ).

[h1]ИТОГ[/h1]

Из всех игр в этом жанре, эта мне понравилась меньше всего. Советую её только тем, кто очень сильно любит этот жанр, или хочет ещё одну 100% игру.
Моя оценка 6/10.

С уважением m@ximov -  [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/steamorators] "Ораторы ste@m". [/url]

21181866.review:
Что может омрачить визит в гости к вашему старому наставнику, заменившему вам отца, больше, чем увидеть, как этого наставника похищает гигантский человекоподобный робот? Утаскивает его в железной клетке в сторону замка злобного тирана. А вы остаетесь на руинах разрушенной гостиницы, и сверху вас засыпает снег, пыль и жучки… Вот такую сцену можно будет увидеть в этой игре – головоломке в декорациях стимпанка.  
Как свойственно стимпанковским произведениям, Clockwork Tales показывает мир, где человеческий разум берет под контроль машины. Они предстают очеловеченными и не зря украшаются разными инкрустациями и узорами, а чтобы радовать глаз. Конфликта между органиками и синтетиками практически нет. Тогда как в других жанрах, например, киберпанк, машины могут подчинять людей, либо напрямую, либо  показывают мир, где чем совершеннее прогресс, тем менее человечно общество (и менее похоже на людей). Но в этой игре возникает угроза того, что человек, решивший управлять армией машин, - злой гений.  И героине необходимо его остановить и машину его землетрясную сломать. Да и для наставника она – последняя надежда.
Вообще в этой игре 2 злодея: Барбер и созданная им механическая многоножка. Не в каждой игре найдется такое хищное и ужасное чудовище. Многоножка тоже довольно неприятна. Но она всего лишь машина. А Барберу, конечно, нужна не власть над миром, а психиатр. Жаль, что мало раскрыли его характер. Непонятно, как он стал таким. Папа ли его так воспитал (мужчина на картине в замке), или жажда власти в нем пробудилась вопреки стараниям окружающих, может быть, после какой-то травмы? Если вы внимательно приглядитесь к изображению Барбера на постере игры, или попробуете поздороваться с ним за руку, вы поймете, что у этого типа, скажем так, много общего с Дартом Вейдером. Кстати, его звание - генерал-инженер – реальное воинское звание, существовавшее в Российской империи до 1917 года. Хотя тут может быть просто совпадение. 
А у героини с определенного этапа появляется помощник – механический ворон. Он может добраться до каких-то предметов на высоте. И вообще с ним не так скучно и не так страшно прыгать вниз дирижабля на планере, спасаясь от солдат. 
Пожалуй, без преувеличения можно сказать, что эта игра – шедевр разработчиков, по крайней мере на тот год выпуска. У нее есть стиль. Сцены поиска предметов очень тщательно прорисованы. Не просто валяется куча предметов, из них надо что-то выбирать по списку. Нет, размещены предметы аккуратно, чувствуется, что они спрятаны с хитрым умыслом. Мини-игр много. Некоторые из них перекочевали в другие игры этого производителя или из них в неизменном виде. Но это не вызывает особого разочарования. Наоборот, знакомые головоломки удобнее проходить. Еще, пожалуй, в этой игре идет поиск самых забавных объектов. Я имею в виду паровых жучков. Они ползают по локациям, хотя некоторых надо доставать из плафонов ламп, проводя разные манипуляции. Даже если вы не любите насекомых, интересно почитать описания всех этих алкогольных муравьев, багов, жуков, обученных носить письма в тюрьму и т.д. Также игра очень дружелюбна в плане получения всех достижений.   
Clockwork Tales переводится не «Истории на время», а скорее «Заводные истории». Имена у героев говорящие. Инк переводится чернила, а Гласс – стекло. Барбер – морозный ветер.  Но если тут есть какой-то тайный смысл, мне он остался непонятен. Финал очень скомканный. Но это та ситуация, когда процесс прохождения интереснее, чем результат. 
В целом, это замечательная игра, как для любителей квестов по поиску предметов, так и для тех, кто только открывает для себя этот жанр.

20920639.review:
Um bom jogo que mistura puzzles de encontrar objetos com puzzles de combinação de itens de inventário. Alguns são bastante desafiadores, mas no geral o jogo é muito casual e fácil. Há a possibilidade de pular o puzzle caso você fique preso nele por muito tempo.

Graficamente o jogo é muito bonito, com certeza essa é a empresa que faz os jogos mais bem acabados que conheço. O 2D é impecável e os efeitos 3D que aparecem são simples.

O jogo só peca na história, que é extremamente simples, sem reviravoltas e com poucos personagens. E é bastante curto, em menos de 4 horas é possível completar o jogo sem dificuldades.

Paguei cerca de 5 reais em promoção e acho que é um preço mais do que justo para quem procura puzzles e um jogo com acabamento de primeira. Possui legendas em português e vários colecionáveis caso queira completar 100%. O replay é inexistente uma vez que você já sabe a solução dos quebra cabeças. Possui achievements e não possui cartas colecionáveis steam.

这是通关的第25个steam游戏了。一句话，就是典型的artifex mundi游戏，画面精美，谜题经典，全简中化。
另外呢，永不磨灭的女主角，到了番外才是标题里的英克教授做主角，然而内容还是讲述教授如何落入敌人手中的。。。
这作流程感觉有点短啊，也许是玩的类型游戏多了解谜速度加快而已。背景剧情还是蒸汽朋克的感觉，人物的装扮像19世纪人，但是科学家雕像里面还有爱因斯坦，看来是个架空历史。  找隐藏物简单了很多，每个场景都有一只机械昆虫，别漏了就全收集了。
最后还得说，有中文真好。

20579653.review:
One of the good Artifex Mundi titles. Excellent voice acting, beautiful art, cute steam-bug collecting achievements, interesting mini games and a fairly compelling plot. Awesome alliance between a young white woman (Evangeline) and an older white gentleman (Ink) and no annoying romances. For a Hidden Object / Point and Click / Casual, it's nice. I love Matthew, the mechanical crow, as the "helper" character.

The only lazy piece of the storytelling was making Germans the Bad Guys. Thanks to World War II, this is still something I readily accept as a plot in a game, but I found myself getting philosophical about it. None of us plan to forget - the Germans included - so does the stereotype serve a useful purpose in 21st century gaming?

19820283.review:
Evangeline Glass is called by her friend, Dr. Ink, to the city of Hochwald, after a series of earthquakes threatening the region are detected. Unfortunately for her, he disappeared and Evangeline must face an enemy set to conquer the world!

Clockwork Tales is for me perhaps one of the weakest games produced by Artifex Mundi. Yeah, true, the plot is enjoyable and I don't mind the steampunk world, rarely visited in HO. But it doesn't have the same magic that goes with the other titles.

However, the gameplay is still the same: puzzles, hidden objects, etc.. Here, you'll have also a little companion, a mechanical bird, that can find stuff out of your reach. It's a nice addition.

What I loved the most in the game is the soldier's design. I loved the uniform, maybe because it's kinda making me think to Darth Vader or the Combines. But what is also fresh in this game is that the city isn't a big steampunk town but a little village in a snowy mountain. Besides, you'll also visit a castle, so, it's maybe a steampunk world but you're not drowning in it.

Anyway, as any AM's game, this one can be bought eyes closed. Given the number of times it has been in a bundle, I suggest you to wait for one of them if you don't really want to buy it at 8 bucks.

19723517.review:
[b]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/b], another gem designed by Hidden Object Games (HOG) masters, Artifex Mundi, offers a lot of story at a reasonable enough pace. The game can be completed in under 5 hours, on expert mode, so it's not too demanding where you can't still play it casually. Does that even make sense...? 

The story begins in a small town known as Hochwald - presumably somewhere in Germany. While a once peaceful town, you will quickly find that that is the case no more. Agent Evangelie Glass is summoned by her friend and mentor, Dr. Ink, who is on a mission to uncover the mysterious secrets of the Barber family. Hochwald has, ultimately, been plagued by increasingly powerful tremors, and Dr. Ink has landed himself in trouble by attempting to sabotage "master inventor Barber", the latter of whom does not have the town in his best interest. With the help of a little mechanical bird, named Matthew, do you have what it takes to thwart Barber's evil plans?

[h1]Pros[/h1]
+  If you're into them, achievements are very easy to obtain
+  The graphics are easily some of the best that I have seen for a HOG
+  The way the story is laid out is good. It is paced evenly and nothing was rushed
+  Voice acting was done extremely well - one of them did make me go, "really?", however
+  Hopefully you don't find the puzzles too difficult. On average, they probably took me about 3 minutes to do. However... (continued in neutral)
+  Play with the music and sound on - do as they recommend; it is amazing and you can tell that they really put in a lot of effort to create a good audio experience for the player

[h1]Neutral[/h1]
±  ... one of the puzzles was giving me trouble and I couldn't get past it for a good 20 minutes. Lack of instructions wasn't too helpful (no kidding), but I eventually got through it

[h1]Con[/h1]
-  The game is extremely short. Even after playing the 2nd half of the game - [b]Ink's Story[/b] - I still ended up with a completion time of under 4 hours. So I would recommend only getting this game once it's bundled or under $2.00
-  I know this is steampunk, but some of the items felt really out of place, especially for the time period. It's like they attempted to fit the 1600s in with some 2010 elements. I can't remember what item I saw (it was during a hidden object scene), but it made me question the time frame; there were actually a few items

While on your mission to save Dr. Ink and the whole town from thheir demise, you will uncover a beautifully told story, wonderful adventures,  and stunning graphics. Give it a good go, and [b]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/b] will most definitely not disappoint.

Overall:
[h1]8/10[/h1]

19635690.review: Хорошая и более чем достойная игра для поклонников Artifex Mundi и Hidden Object в целом. Очень красивая графика, в лучших традициях компании: волшебные ролики, арты, задники. Лицевая анимация только немного подкачала - лица очень уж неестественно дёргаются при разговоре, но на это можно просто не обращать внимание. Все задачки интересные и не особенно сложные, некоторые, вроде зарядки батареи от молнии прямо-таки поражают (не пытайтесь повторить это дома! - должны были сказать разработчики, но скажу за них я). Да ещё и стимпанковый сеттинг со всеми вытекающими: механическая птица, много всяких разных и прекрасных механизмов, даже альтернативная религия есть, с поклонением Тесле, Ньютону, Менделееву и Эйнштейну - в общем, атмосфера отличная. Недостатка я нашла всего два: игра достаточно короткая, на эксперте и с бонусной историей её можно пройти часа за четыре; и второй - сюжетная линия довольно скомканная. Ощущение, что нас выкинули по середине истории, ничего толком не объяснив, поэтому главные герои обо всём знают, а вот мы - игроки - не очень. Каковы мотивы и цели главного злодея? Как Инк и Гласс вообще на него вышли, откуда узнали? Неясно. Впрочем, для меня финальный арт основной истории все недостатки искупил вполне.

19461424.review:
A really handsome click and point game with a European, historical steampunk setting. It's clear a lot of care has been taken on this, and especiallly on the little clockwork bird who helps you during your puzzles in the game. The bird's design is particularly nice and it was always enjoyable to send your flying friend off on some task, throughout the whole game.

It's more of a puzzle game than a hidden object one, which suited me fine. Al]though there are bonus hidden object screens unlocked at the end of the game, if you're left wanting more.

Pros:
- Great art, especially the backgrounds and that clockwork bird.
- The story is pretty light, but the writing is good. I felt in safe hands.
- I found the puzzles to be just right. Professor Layton level, although simpler in setup.
- Enjoyably competent female main character, but one who doesn't suddenly start shooting people or killing them with big swords out of nowhere.
- Emphasis on solving problems through intelligence, not violence.

Cons:
- If you like hidden object games, you might be a little disappointed since the game is mostly puzzles.

Definitely recommend, and I look forward to seeing more in this series.

19376670.review: HOG게임 입문용으로 적절하다. 스토리나 퍼즐은 특별할게 없기에 제작사도 그외의 요소들 (스팀펑크 세계관, 일러스트, 음악,풀보이스 더빙)에 신경을 꽤 썼다. 퍼즐이나 스토리는 심심하지만 앞서 언급한 요소들때문에 차 한잔 마시며 플레이 하기 안성맞춤. 다만 아티픽스 먼디의 다른 게임을 또 한번 해보고 이렇게 나쁘지 않은 평가를 내릴진 의문이다. 아마 하나 더 구매해보면 알수있을것 같은데 아티픽스 먼디는 이런걸 노리는것 같다.(HOG공장 제작사)
