19352748.review:
Gorgeous game, very good up to the end and then it falls flat on its face.  The ending is very abrupt.  One minute you're immersed in the adventure and the next, the heroine is telling you, "Oh we escaped and the villain got his comeuppance" It barely works as a conclusion and you're left feeling like someone left the last page intact in a novel but tore out the preceding 10 pages.

Still I do recommend it for all fans of Hidden Object Games and Steampunk.

19324423.review: "Of Glass and Ink" is a solid, polished example of the hidden-object genre with no significant flaws, if you forgive the absurdly one-dimensional characters as a normal part of the genre.  I recommend playing on "Expert" here, even if you don't do so in most HOGs; this series leans to the easy end of the spectrum.

18906626.review:
[h1]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink - приключение в сеттинге стимпанка,основанное на поиске предметов и решении головоломок.[/h1]

[u]Плюсы:[/u]

- Геймплей - радует обилие разнообразных головоломок и поиск множества предметов для их решения
- Графика - очень симпатично прорисованная картинка до мельчайших подробностей

[u]Минусы:[/u]

- Неудачная локализация - некоторые предметы переведены неправильно,и это усложняет их поиск.
- Небольшая продолжительность - игру можно пройти вдоль и поперек за 5-6 часов.

[u]Вывод:[/u] Игра однозначно заставит напрячь извилины для ее прохождения + часто продается по большим скидкам = брать непременно.

18865496.review: Para aventureiros que gostam de hidden object é uma ótima pedida em gráficos, história e puzzles. Puzzles simples mas história envolvente e que te prende até o fim, vale a pena conferir :D

18724651.review:
Carino e originale questo hidden object. E' diverso dai soliti HO, più vario ad essere precisi. Si passa da puzzles a scovare gli oggetti e a combinarli attraverso precise mosse e non risulta mai noioso. Non ci sono particolari difficoltà con gli enigmi e li ho trovati sempre tutti facilmente risolvibili (perfetto per chi comincia con le avventure grafiche). La storia è interessante e si gioca tutta d'un fiato anche se il finale non è nulla di particolare e poteva essere decismanete sviluppato meglio. Bellissimi i disegni. Musiche ripetitive effetti sonori nella norma e parlato in inglese scarso a volte davvero pessimo, diciamo altamente "amatoriale".
Per finire lo sviluppatore Artifex Mundi è sempre un sinonimo di qualità sugli HO e anche se in questo caso qualche cosa è un gradino qualitativamente più basso, mi sento di raccomandarlo lo stesso.
A patto che si compri in sconto, quindi aspettate le continue offerte che ci sono su questi tipi di giochi, non solo su Steam ma anche in altri siti.

18507422.review:
Another nice hidden-object game from Artifex Mundi. Recomended to every fan of this kind of games, especially during a sale!

Pros: + Nice steampunk setting, very good and quite original (at least for this kind of games) story. 
+ Very nice graphics, atmospheric music and good voice-acting
+ Good variety of locations to visit.
+ Variety of hidden-object scenes/puzzles and some of them are quite challenging.
+ The use of the mechanical raven to reach distant items is a nice addition.

Cons: - I didn't really like the animation of the characters' faces while they speak.
- You interact with a small number of people.
- Very short duration - it took me 3.5 hours to fully complete it, while playing in the extreme mode and using the hint button 3-4 times (and all of them because I didn't think to check the h/o scenes twice).

面白かった！
４，５時間でクリアした。

がっつりゲームはしたくないけど、何かしたかった時にプレイした。

クリックで謎解きして進めるアドベンチャーゲーム。
公式で日本語化されてて安心。（UIと字幕のみ）

最初は簡単、中盤から難しいのもあって、程よい難易度。
行き詰ったり、飽きたらすぐ止めた。
頭がすっきりしてて、やりたくなった時にやるとすっと解ける。
そんな風に進めた。

唐突に始まって、あっさりしたエンディングで最後は盛り上がりに欠けて、突っ込みいれてしまう。

とはいえ、丁寧な絵柄と音楽が雰囲気あってグッド！
ウィンドウモードの少し小さな画面のほうが、引き伸ばされず綺麗だし、気軽に出来ていい。
場面に合う耳に残るようなＢＧＭも最近のゲームではあまりなくなってきたから心地よかった。

格安セールで買うならおすすめ！
たまにはこういうゲームもいいね。

18299774.review:
Классическая игра для этого жанра. Рисунок мне показался несколько грубоватым, зато колоритным. Нет вычурности и слащавости. Злобный стим-панковский фашик, профессор, как водится немного чокнутый, алкаши-аборигены в пабе - всё очень мило, правда.
Музыка и звуки не раздражают точно.
Инвентарь не перегружен, предметы быстро используются по назначению. Не комбинируются.
Сцены поиска авторы постарались разнообразить.
Загадки тоже типичные, несложные в основном.
Есть интерактивная карта и питомец. Подсказки. Достижения. Карточки. Бонусная глава.
Недостаток, собственно, только один: игра коротковата, приключений, локаций будет немного.
В общем и целом крепенький такой середнячок, 7 паровых жуков из 10.

18269294.review:
Очень хороший, но короткий (часов на 4~5) квест в стим-панковском антураже. Есть сюжет, по которому постоянно показываются ролики и рассказывается история. Загадки по большей части привязаны к повествованию, так что своей "типичностью" они не надоедают (кроме бонусной главы, в неё, похоже, запихали все те загадки, которые не смогли адекватно привязать к основному сюжету). Есть вполне сложные загадки.
Отличная викторианская стилизация, музыка (с контрабасом и тикающими мотивами), всякие бегающие механические букашки, паровые роботы, шестерёночные механизмы и даже часовой компьютер!

P.S. Шрифт русской локализации не соответствует оригиналу (игру проходил на английском). Как и положено порядочному стим-панку, главный злодей повелевает армией паровых големов, имеет шрамы на лице, носит монокль и одна из его рук -- механическая!

18233209.review:
Очередная игра для девочек. В этот раз мы ни много ни мало спасаем мир от чудовищной машины и злодея, в роли которого выступает конечно же недалекий мужчинка-солдафон, который толком то и своей землетрясной машиной не умеет пользоваться, зато хочет всех поработить, убить, веселье запретить и вообще по максимуму всех обидеть. С этой целью он окружил себя бездушными роботами способными выдержать его жестокость, они же воплощают в жизнь его зловещие планы. Игра ни сюжетом, ни сложностью загадок не блещет, единственный плюс за стимпанк.
Рекомендую девочкам\девушкам, желающим хоть где-то показаться умными и самоутвердиться над "тупыми" мужиками.

Итог: 5 из 10.

18149570.review:
I recommend this game based on the fact I play A LOT of hogs (hidden object games) and Artifex Mundi continue to show that they are competent developers as this is but one of their games in this genre. I'll keep it short and sweet:

[h1]+++++[/h1]
[list]
    [*] Much like Artifex Mundi's other games, Clockwork Tales is visually pleasing to look at, probably not as pretty as some of their other games, mind.
    [*] The game has a decent plot, as far as HOGs go!
    [*] Achievements are varied and aren't too punishing to achieve, allowing easy 100% completion for those interested ;)
    [*] Features include several supported languages and steam trading cards. There are 6 cards to collect, so it's not too bad a grind to complete a set for the badges.
    [*] Fairly decent completion time, doesn't feel overly long.
[/list]

[h1]-----[/h1]
[list]
    [*] A couple of the puzzles may have you tearing your hair out for a while, I was forced to cheat and look at a walkthrough for one of them (although this may because I have the dumb).
    [*] Not enough hidden object parts for my liking but perhaps the game will suit people who prefer puzzle and exploration elements better.
    [*] Some games are purely reskinned versions from other Artifex Mundi games and don't include many puzzles that stand out in the genre - although this is a common feature among a lot of HOGs!
    [*] When not on sale I think the price may put some people off for what is essentially a small amount of game time, although established fans of the genre probably won't be deterred by this at all.
[/list]

What a boring review, I do apologise ;_; Anyhow, not to sound like I'm overly fond of Artifex Mundi or anything but the game is a solid HOG, I've played better but I've also played worse. Clockwork Tales does feel like 'just another HOG' in a way if you play a lot of them, nothing particularly stands out but It's a fun way to spend a few hours, especially if you like games that are easy to 100% or want something that's suitable for all ages (except me at 25 being unable to solve some of the puzzles... ;)).

18138316.review: Big Bang Theory reference in the first two minutes.

18130534.review:
Dalsi povedena a stylova adventura od Artifexu, ktere se snad da vytknout jen jeji kratkost. Max za pet hodin budete mit hotovo vcetne bonusove prequelove kapitoly. Zpracovani se ale neda nic vytknout. Malebne zasnezene prostredi jakesi pseudonemecke visky, do ktere se vratil mistni slechtic s militantnimi plany vyuzit jistou ultimatni zbran na ovladnuti sveta. Aspon tak nejak to chapu z toho, jak je stylizovan do jakehosi "nazi" barona, protoze (to je 2. minus) cile hlavniho padoucha nejsou blize vysvetleny. 
Kazdopadne je jasne, ze ho hrac musi zastavit. Pomaha mu v tom (podobne jako opicak v jine hre Artifexu - "Dark Arcana") pomocnik, zde mechanicky havran, ktereho lze vyslat na nedostupna mista. Klasickych hidden object screenu (HOS) s hledanim dle textu je pomerne malo, coz beru jako plus. Doplnuje je skladackove hledani dle ikon a samozrejme hadankove minihry, ktere mozna lehce prevazuji, ale jsou pomerne snadne a zadny zakys jsem nemel.
Vizual je moc pekny, jedna se o steampunk, takze je zde spousta mechanickych pristroju a udelatek. Na stenach muze pozorny hrac najit easter-eggy v podobe obrazku ze hry "Enigmatis". Jedna hadanka v Inkove kapitole je zase kopii puzzlu ze hry "Abyss". Celkem fajn detaily. Hudebni motiv se take velmi povedl. V teto CE edici hrac klasicky dostane wallpapery, OST, zminenou bonusovou kapitolu ci par artworku. 
Achievementy jsou tentokrat bezva - zadna nutnost dohravat hru dvakrat, takze hned napoprve je muzete mit vsechny. Dokonce zde nejsou zadne "na cas", jako udelat minihru ci HOS do minuty apod. To je podle me plus. Jsou prevazne pribehove a jen jeden by mohl delat problem - hledani mechanickych brouku rozmistenych ruzne ve hre. Pokud ovsem hrac moc nespecha, ani tento achiev neni problem hned napoprve. Steam karty ma hra taky, jen kdybyste chteli hru v cestine, musite opet stahovat z Alawaru...
Jako celek velmi prijemna kratka adventura, ktera ma jen pomerne mdly zaver. Vizuelne ale pritazliva a oddechova.

70%

17987981.review:
スチームパンクアドベンチャーゲーム
とは言っても、ボリュームは少ない（だいたい4～6時間ぐらい目安）ので、期待する程のゴテゴテのスチームパンクさは、それほど敷き詰められてはいない
ここが販売元の作品は、相変わらず気軽にプレイはしやすいので、その点はおすすめ

プレイに関してのまとめ
サクサク進む展開とゲーム性もあり、前半に至ってはかなり出来が良いが
後半気になった部分としては、終盤の一部分とボーナスステージに関しては、御都合主義というかなんというか
無理やりな展開と有り合わせで作った道具を使ったりする部分があったため、その辺りが少々分かり辛く、マイナス点か

デバッグに関して
終盤、バケツに水を入れれないバグがあるが、画面切り替えで直る
あとボーナスステージの男の博士が、ちょこちょこ女言葉で喋るのだが

それほど酷い出来でもなく、秀逸という程でもない

17961117.review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink was the first HOG I have ever completed in my gaming history. I was beginning to feel attracted for the genre and decided to try this one out, due to it's reviews. I must say, I was surprised. This title shines in so many ways, from the art, to voice acting, soundtrack and puzzle originality. The art utilized in Clockwork tales is beautiful and lines up perfectly with the steampunk-ish universe where the story is set up. Voice acting is of high quality and never fails to impress.
 As I mentioned before, this is the first HOG game I've finished, but from the puzzles I completed, I was mostly pleased with their originality, never making gameplay repetitive in any way possible. I was also awed with the animation style and how movement actions are carried out.
 At your disposal, you have a mechanical bird, Matthew, that can be used to reach objects located in, otherwise, unreachable places. the main characters are interesting but due to the small playtime they aren't deeply explored, which leaves you, the player, to acknowledge only superficial information about them.
 Replayability is encouraged due to the existence of achievements such as: complete the game in expert mode, find all hidden bugs and don't misclick in any HOG segments. The bonus chapter, also a prequel to the title's events, is a nice addition and provides background on Professor Ink.
 
[h1]Conclusion: A must have for gamers who enjoy the HOG genre, and an excellent option for some who never played any titles of this nature. Low playtime, but high replayability. Great story, beautiful art and pleasant character design. Interesting steampunk-ish universe, and expanded by a bonus chapter (prequel). Recommend![/h1]

17910870.review:
I have to admit that [i]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i] went and snatched the first place among my favorite Artifex Mundi games so far. I wonder why I haven't played this earlier. I knew I was getting myself a satisfactory HOG when I bought this, but I had no idea that I'll be having this grand a deal in HOG genre!

In a fictional steampunk version of 1700 Prussia, we take the role of Evangeline Glass; Dr. Ink's protégé and engineer extraordinaire. We hit the road to meet with the good doctor in Hochwald, part of Habsburg Monarchy at the time, on a letter that we receive from him earlier. Dr. Ink has been making a research on the alarmingly raising number of earthquakes that were dominating the area. He claims that he has proof that a corruption in local authority is responsible: General Engineer is abusing a dangerous machine to create these earthquakes and he should be stopped at once!

At this point, we all know what kind of game that we should be expecting from Artifex Mundi: beautiful artwork, genuine animations, charming setting, and a curious story. Above all our common expectations, [i]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i] covers a narration and a period so dark, yet envelops it with fair music and an atmosphere straight out of fables. The marriage of Austrian culture with Enlightenment science gives birth to this amazing game. As a personal favorite, I couldn't avoid to mention the puzzle of Saints during the bonus chapter, which is a direct example of this marriage. Did I mention the artwork? I know I'm trying my chance, but even the achievements interface itself is an artwork, made of stain glass!

Gameplay is ordinary, yet the adventure elements of assembling machines are fairly imaginative. There aren't many HOG scenes, rather FROG - fragmented object game - scenes dominating this particular game. There is little to no backtracking, and a full functioning map. Puzzles are the kind that we are used to by now. As a change, in this particular adventure, we have the luxury of utilizing Matthew, a mechanical crow that we send out to gather items out of our reach, which spices the gameplay a bit up. We are also entitled to enjoy a bonus chapter at the end, to experience Dr. Ink's short adventure before Evangeline's arrival. The game is pretty short, being 5 hours or so with the bonus chapter.

Once I've completed the bonus chapter, I wholeheartedly wished there would be a series of Clockwork Tales games. I usually prefer downright fantasy or at least mythological elements in storylines, but [i]Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink[/i] is an elegant exception that I'll let myself be enthusiastic about. As a side note, I'm in love with the steam machine crow named Matthew!

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

17901562.review:
As you would expect from any AM HOG, this is a fairly well polished game (for the genre), which is easy to play and has a decent storyline, in this case set in a steampunk fantasy world. While the game isn't particularly long, it is otherwise hard to criticize - the story moves along reasonably well, the gameplay is solid throughout - the HOG scenes are good, the point and click and puzzles all flow fairly well and make sense.

Probably the main area it could have been improved would have been better characterization or development of the three main characters, you barely interact with the main bad guy, and you only talk to your mentor a couple of times, so most of the story is developed through the protagonist narrating what is happening. Despite that, this is one of the better HOG games around, so it is an easy one to recommend for those that like this type of game.

"Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink" is one of Artifex Mundi's best casual adventure Hidden Object Games (HOGs). 17524136.review:
The good: Enjoyable ambient sounds, voices, and music. Has a fairly good art style; more light fantasy steampunk for most of the game (as opposed to some of the dark gritty steampunk types you can find). You can turn the visual hints for puzzles on or off depending on the difficulty. Some of the puzzles are challenging, and the hidden objects puzzles are fun (although on the easy side). 

The bad: It's rather short (I have 10 hours on record, but most of that is because I walked off to get lunch and stayed away from my computer and forgot to exit out of the game). The game takes certain tools out of your inventory once you use them; I guess it's not uncommon with this type of game, but I find it really annoying when I have to go hunt down another tool to do a job when I just had one that could have worked and it was taken away because reasons. 

General info: Gameplay is a linear point-and-click story with logic/hidden object puzzles thrown in every so often. The story is a little cliché, but otherwise ok. 

Overall: If you like point-and-click puzzlers or hidden object games, this is a fun little afternoon jaunt; I would recommend it.

System Specs Used: Intel Core i7-3610QM, Nvidia GeForce GTX 670M / 3GB GDDR5, DDRIII 12GB RAM, Windows 7

17515203.review:
I'm not the sort to prejudice games over things like their being hidden object puzzlers; and the Artifex Mundi games are by far the best examples of the genre. Nonetheless A.M. has followed the method of if it isn't broke don't fix it, meaning they reuse their puzzles with cosmetic variations from one game to another. This has the unfortunate result that if you've played one of their games you've played them all.

That's O.K. if you think of the games as more visual novels with bonus puzzle content. Granted the writing isn't amazing; but it isn't bad either. I know I've yet to play an A.M. game I could make myself stop playing before the end. That's, on average, over 3 hours in one sitting. And, most of their games include a bonus chapter that extends gameplay another hour.

They do manage to do this without unnecessarily padding game length that overstays its welcome. I know that doesn't sound like much in an industry with triple AAA titles that boast hundred of hours of gameplay. But, for cheap casual games this is an achievement.

My recommendation, because of the "if you've played one you've played them all" problem, is pare your selections down to their better games. That would be Enigmatis 2 (but not the mediocre Enigmatis: the Ghosts of Maple Creek) as a top pick, Grim Legends 1 & 2 if you liked that, and the Nightmares from the Deep trilogy if you just can't get enough of these games.

17143227.review:
Another lovely HOG from the minds of Artifex Mundi! Clockwork Tales is definitely a good game for those who love the steampunk aesthetic, as well as hidden object games! Albeit a bit short, the game has a certain charm to it that I've yet to see in this genre. But, without further adieu, on to the review!

[b][h1]=Complete Review=[/h1][/b] (TL:DR version and Conclusion at the bottom)

[h1]=The Story: 3/5=[/h1] The story is a bit interesting. Your old friend, Dr. Ink, has made a discovery correlating to the mysterious earthquakes around the world, and Hochwald, a small mountain town close by to the mysterious castle of the Barber family. You play as Evangeline Glass, and it's up to you to save Ink, and put a stop to the cause of the earthquakes.

 While not overly groundbreaking of a story, it's still certainly a little treat. The game is sadly a bit short, in comparison to other games I've played from Artifex Mundi. But, fortunately like other games of theirs, Clockwork Tales provides a prequel story for extra play and to learn more about one of your allies. 

There -was- a scene that was a bit... Odd in my opinion, regarding one of the characters having a bit of a unexpected change of heart in it. But, It was just one of those 'come-and-go' moments. Not a reoccuring theme in the game, fortunately. 

[h1]=The User Interface: 3/5=[/h1]  With the user interface I was a bit disappointed with the lack of a more in-character journal-keeping function, like the ones in the Enigmatis games. However, having the clockwork bird, Matthew, to aid in puzzles and add a extra bit of actual functionality to the game made up for it. 

The UI is also well designed, and has it's own artistic flair to it, which I've come to expect from the skilled hands of these developers. So while there isn't an abundance of bells and whistles, there certainly is some eye-catching beauty to the interface itself, down to the pointer. 

[h1]=The Gameplay: 4/5=[/h1] The gameplay is pretty standard, and as you'd expect from a hidden object game. Artifex Mundi's games are very good about making sure things don't look horribly out of place in scenes, and this is no exception. So while it's not a ground breaker (pun not intended) among their own games, it's still a cut above most the HOGs I've seen and played.

A fair amount of the puzzles in the game I've seen and played before, but that's not necessarily bad. A little lacking in originality, but you know what they say, "Don't fix what isn't broken". And they do have a couple puzzles in here that I've yet to see in the other two games of theirs I've played, which is always a treat.

For those looking for a little more challenge, or to make things easier, there are three different difficulties. Being Casual, for those who are more interested in the story than gameplay. Advanced, for those who want more challenge, but not too much. And Expert, for the people who don't want things to be all that easy on them. The difficulties mainly affect how easily you can see where to go, and how quick your hints recharge. I myself prefer Expert, as I prefer to do no-hint runs.  

[h1]=The Graphics: 3/5=[/h1] While the story isn't too impressive, the graphics make up a bit for it. As stated before, Artifex Mundi is good about making both objects and background work together in harmony. So you don't have to worry about seeing horribly stretched images that look like they were swiped off of google. Everything works well in it's environment, and doesn't stick out horribly. 

The places you get to explore look lively, and nicely drawn. From the snowy outdoors with storms in the distance, to the vibrant warmth of the inside of the tavern with it's patrons sitting down to warm up. 

My only downside, as seems to be common with Artifex' games, would be the talking animations. Which, I'm really hoping they've worked on in their latest games. They did a good job of making sure the person speaking moves their head, as one would do when speaking. But it still looks a little... Odd? Definitely not one of their strong points. 

[h1]=The Audio: 3/5=[/h1]  The music is quite charming, and it's enjoyable. Not exactly the kind of thing you'd get addicted to listening to, but it has a elegance to it that is nice on the ears while you concentrate on the game. 
The sound effects work nicely, and for the most part, match what is 'triggering' the sfx. So that's always nice. I hope I'm not the only one who finds it so annoying when the sound doesn't match what is supposed to be making the sound. So finding out that this game doesn't have that problem is nice. 

The voices were rather well done, and fit the kind of people in the setting pretty well. Some of them weren't exactly.. Well... My cup of tea... But, I won't deny that they at least fit the character speaking. And I'm happy that the game at least has consistant voice acting, rather than some characters being voiced and others not. 

[h1]=The Atmosphere: 4/5=[/h1] I personally love the atmosphere of the game. I'm not one of those kinds of people who are in love with the steampunk aesthetic, but I do have to admit it's a pretty cool style and concept. And the game certainly does keep in touch with the aesthetic, with blimps, and clockwork bugs (which you have to find) as well as steampunk inventions abound!  

There aren't really any items that logically would not be in that time period, which I've noticed that this developer is particularly good with. You'd be surprised at how many HOGs can't get that sort of thing down. A cellphone in a middle-aged castle, go figure. Fortunately none of that sort is in this game.  

It's definitely a lighter-hearted steampunk game, so it's not all that gritty. The bright artstyle helps to enforce this. It concentrates mainly on the inventions and the victorian stylistic, which is common with Steampunk. So those who are looking for a darker-and-edgier steampunk esque game would not find such in this game.

[b][h1]=TL;DR/Pros & Cons=[/h1][/b]

[b]Pros[/b]
UI is well crafted, and has a clockwork bird companion (once you fix him).
Lovely Steampunk aesthetic, makes for a nicely styled HOG.
Backgrounds and Hidden Object scenes are nicely executed.
Three different difficulty options to allow players to pick their level of play.
Fully voiced dialogue with characters, which is always a plus.
Achievements! Boy I love me a game with achievements. 
Clockwork. Bird. Companion. I think that deserves another mention.

[b]Neutral[/b]
Lighter-toned Steampunk Game, not much nitty-gritty here.
Voice acting! Kinda a "Your mileage may vary" thing.
Story wasn't all that intense.

[b]Cons[/b]
Game felt way too short, which is the major problem with this game.
Not many puzzles or hidden object scenes. Pretty big downer since that's the point of this genre.
The talk animations... Oooh boy... Do they definitely need some work.
The very weird and kinda OOC moment in the Prequel story. Still has me scratching my head.

[b][h1]=The Conclusion: 6.5/10=[/h1][/b] All in all, it's a charming game for sure. However the short-length and lack of more puzzles hits this game's rating [b]real[/b] hard. If Steam had a neutral rating, I'd definitely pick that for this game. As there's plenty of good points, but bad points as well. So I'd say this is a lower-end positive rating. If the game's on sale for real cheap, it'd be a good idea to grab. But the bad points make it hard to justify buying it full-price.

I appreciate your time, and thank you for reading this review~.

그런데 퍼즐 풀기 좋아하는 사람에겐 추천한다. 꽤나 흥미로운 퍼즐이 많았고, 나름 재미있었다 너무 어려워서 못 풀겠다 정도도 아니고 완전 쉬운것도 아니라 적당히 재미 볼 수 있다.
숨은그림찾기는 개인적으로 재미없었는데, 특히 골렘창고에서 숨은그림찾기 어후...
방탈출이랑 비슷하긴한데.. 뭔가 억지스러운 면도 있다.

플레이 타임도 짧기 때문에 할인기간 아니면 사는 건 비추천이다.

하지만 퍼즐게임 좋아한다면 이 게임은 꽤나 괜찮게 다가 올 수 있다.
필자는 이런 퍼즐게임 좋아해서 추천하지만 이거 아니였으면 비추천이다.

16202584.review:
Game Information

Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink CE, is a HOPA game, that is developed and published by Artifex Mundi.

 CE - Collector's Edition.
 HOPA - Hidden Object Puzzle Adventure.

Since this is a collector's edition game, it comes with extra features, that are not available in its' counterpart; standard edition.

Game Visuals

I want to mentioned that the visuals in the game is nicely done with painted feel to them. The visuals can be adjusted in the game's option menu.

Game Audio

I want to mentioned that audio in the game is well done even if it is simplistic and somewhat repetitive. The audio can be adjusted in the game's option menu as well.

Gameplay

There are three different difficulty game modes choose from: Casual; Advanced and Expert.

The notebook keep tracks of progression in the game. Such as story events and clues.

There is an interactive map in the game. It allows the player to fast travel between each location quickly. It also indicates that there are certain tasks that needs to be completed at certain locations within the game. The interactive map is automatically given at the start of the game.

There is a padlock feature that is available to lock the inventory panel in place to make it stationary.

The hidden object scenes consists of the following: Fragmented items; Shadow items and Traditional word lists. Some of these hidden object scenes may require little or no interactions. Most of the hidden object scenes can be replayed in the game's extra feature section.

The puzzles are fairly easy to solve without having the need to skip any of them. Some of these puzzles can be replayed in the game's extra feature section.

There is a helper in the game: Matthew the steampunk mechanical bird. Matthew can help the player with certain tasks that they cannot complete themselves.

There is a collectible in the game: Steambug. They are scattered throughout the game for the player to find.

Since this is a collector's edition, there is a bonus chapter, it can be access only after the main story is completed.

There are nineteen different achievements that can be unlocked from playing the game. Each of these achievements does come with some requirements that needs to be completed before they can be unlocked.

Miscellaneous

The extra feature contents: Bonus Chapter; Bonus Hidden Object Scenes; Bonus Puzzles; Soundtracks; Concept Art and Wallpapers. Most of these extra features can be access only after the entire game is completed.

There six different trading cards to collect. You only get three of those trading cards from the game. There are several ways to get the rest of the trading cards: Purchased from the Steam's Community Market; Trade with friends; Booster Packs and its' Booster Pack Creator.

Final thoughts: I have found the game enjoyable to certain extent. The replay value for this game is low. I would recommend this game but not at the game's full price value.

16098029.review:
A nice and simple mix of point and click, puzzle and hidden object elements. There's nothing overly challenging here, but this type of game tends to fit into the more relaxed category. The story is quite nice, the achievements work. There's an integrated hint system in the unlikely event that you do get stuck (and all the puzzles are skippable if you have problems with them). There are some nice collectibles in the form of mechanical insects as you progress through. The bonus chapter is, as is usual with these titles, a case of throwing the storytelling out of the window in favour of jamming in a  large number of hidden object scenes for no particular reason and just makes you backtrack over areas you've already been in the hope that a new one has suddenly appeared with the item you need to progress. Thankfully the actual game has these integrated into the storyline nicely.

If you like this particular subgenre of hidden object/point and click games it's a nice one.

15899368.review:
This is, so far, the best HOG I've played on steam or anywhere else.

You control Evangeline, who has been summoned to help her old mentor with his secret project. You arrive just to see him being kidnapped and you have to get him back from the evil robot-controlling villain and save the city. You fix your mentors clockwork bird companion Matthew and he helps you throughout the game.

There is a bonus chapter after you finished the game that is a short prequel to the main story.

The art is beautiful, the voice acting is really good and the music is atmospheric. The one problem I had in this game was the sounds in the engine room, which got irritatingly repetitive, but that might have been partially my fault for being slow.

The steampunk-clockwork world has a really good atmosphere and many neat detail, such as the 'church of science'. 

The hidden object and other minigames have a good difficulty, and there's no achievement for not using hints, only for not skipping, which makes life easier.

There is a map and it can be used to teleport. Throughout the game you can collect steambugs, which seem to only be good for the extra challenge and the achievement.

Highly recommended for any gamer, its the kind of game I almost feel bad about buying on sale because it deserves all my moneys.

15872719.review:
Die ungewöhnlichen Ereignisse in dem kleinen Bergdorf Hochwald, verleiten Dr. Ink Nachforschungen zu betreiben. Doch alleine kann er diesen Fall nicht lösen, doch Agent Glass ist bereits informiert.

Insgesamt bietet Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink eine interessante Hintergrundgeschichte, die zwar nicht sonderlich komplex ist, dafür aber gute Unterhaltung bietet. Genre-typisch gibt es Logikaufgaben, sowie einige Wimmelbild-Aufgaben, die allesamt kreativ gestaltet wurden. Die Schwierigkeit der Rätsel bewegt sich auf einem leichten bis mittleren Niveau, ohne den Spieler zu überfordern. Genre-Fans sollten in gut 3 bis 4 Stunden durch die Hauptgeschichte kommen, wobei die Bonusaufgaben mit Dr. Ink zusätzliche 20 bis 30 Minuten Spielspass bieten.

Als Kritik sei nur gesagt, dass der Einsatz des kleinen Dampfvogels Matthew zu sporadisch ist - hier wäre noch zusätzliches Potenzial gewesen. Ebenfalls sind einige Sprecher eher schwer zu ertragen, wobei Agent Glass und Dr. Ink sehr gut vertont wurden. Auch sind die Spracheinlagen der Soldaten des Generalingenieurs witzig anzuhören, da diese ein gebrochenes Englisch mit deutsche Begriffen sprechen.

Wie gewohnt liefert Artifex Mundi Premium-Qualität im Wimmelbild/Adventure-Bereich, was auch an den tollen Hintergründen liegt. Freunde ruhiger Abenteuer sollten definitiv einen Blick riskieren.

15861295.review: Nice puzzle focused adventure game happening in a steampunk world. Great graphics, funny puzzles. It's quite short though - around 3 hours of gameplay. There is an in game "hint" system implemented that tips you where to go next when you are blocked - cool feature for me.

15837927.review:
Este é o meu terceiro jogo do gênero Hidden Objects, sendo que é o primeiro jogo da Artifex Mundi que joguei e zerei.
De fato a Artifex Mundi é conhecida por seus belos jogos neste gênero e eu diria que o ponto mais alto da desenvolvedora é na parte gráfica (arte) do jogo. É simplesmente impecável e cada local do jogo é incrívelmente bonito.

O jogo tem um enredo bacana, a trilha sonora é muito boa, a arte é incrível, o trabalho de voz é bem fraco, os puzzles são bacanas (tem de todos os níveis) e o jogo está totalmente em Português.

É uma ótima pedida para o jogador que procura um jogo casual e divertido quando não se tem nada para fazer e quer passar o tempo.

Recomendo pegar na promoção!

The game features a great steampunk setting and is an overall quite a well done hidden object game, as typical for Artifex Mundi. The pacing of the story is a little bit more speedy and actiony this time around, which is a welcome change.

However it is just barely three hours long and only two hours of that are for the main game. The story just feels a little incomplete overall and a lot of stuff never gets fleshed out. So overall it's not a bad game at all, but it feels more like half a game, then a full game. It's really good, there just isn't nearly enough of it to make a satisfying experience.

15736332.review:
I thought that this P&C/Hidden Object game was one of the better I have played. It is a little on the easy side so playing on the highest difficulty is best. The story is fine, but it is the polish that really worked for me. The music and graphics are solid and the hidden object puzzles are actually scenes that make sense instead of a random assortment of meaningless objects. That attention to detail is rare.

In addition, the bonus content for the game is really added playtime. It is not just a rehash of the places and puzzles you have done before.

Overall, a really good game in this genre.

Other than that devastating act of wildlife abuse, I was delighted in the overall gameplay.

Just another reason I will always trust in Artifex Mundi! (Just remember AM, there's no such thing as too many cute animal friends)

14448519.review:
Le moins que l'on puisse dire, c'est que Clockwork Tales est une vraie bonne surprise.

En soi, le jeu ne paie pas de mine : c'est un Point And Click de facture assez classique et dont le gameplay est surtout basé sur la résultion d'énigmes variées à la difficulté croissante (mais qui restent à la portée de tous) ou sur la recherche d'objets cachés dans les décors parcourus (rassurez-vous, ce n'est pas du Pixel Hunting pur et dur).

Côté scénaristique, l'histoire est somme toute assez classique et est très linéaire. Pas question de faire des choix moraux, ici. On se laisse juste porter par ce petit conte écrit dans la plus pure tradition Steampunk tout en étant bercé par des musiques plutôt agréables.

Incontestablement, la plus grande réussite du jeu, c'est son aspect graphique : chaque niveau est un véritable tableau intéractif et animé qu'on croirait peint à la main. Et le moins que l'on puisse dire, c'est que c'est très beau et très réussi. Chapeau de ce côté-là.

Après, il faut quand même savoir que le jeu a malgré deux petits défauts. Le premier, c'est le voice acting, pas toujours au niveau de ce qu'on pourrait attendre. Ça passe parce que c'est un petit jeu réalisé par un studio indépendant, mais quand même, ça nuit parfois un peu à l'immersion.

Le deuxième défaut du jeu, c'est sa durée de vie assez faible : selon votre façon de jouer et selon que vous cherchiez à débloquer tous les succès ou non, il faut compter entre 3 et 7 heures de jeu, tout en sachant que la rejouabilité est assez limitée (une fois le jeu terminé en mode Expert, il n'y a plus rien à faire). Un peu plus de densité et de contenu n'auraient pas été malvenus.

En conclusion, pour peu que vous aimez le style Steampunk et/ou que vous appréciez les Point And Click, Clockwork Tales méritera vraiment le détour. Ne reste que le problème de la durée de vie assez faible qui pourra justifier pour certains d'attendre une éventuelle promotion.

14332558.review:
The game itself is short, about 2 hours of playtime if you're halfway good at solving hidden object puzzles. 

The story is mostly there, but has some strange gaping holes in it. There's a lot of stuff that simply isn't explained at all, you're just plopped into the middle of it with no real attempt at backstory or even logical explanations of stuff. The villain is a ridiculously shallow stereotype and there's no real character development.

But, I still recommend it. Mostly because it's beautifully drawn, and while there are holes the atmosphere is immersive and enjoyable. With hidden object games like this, the visuals count for more than anything else in my view, and that's where the game succeeds best.

There's a hard mode for people who are REALLY good at these things (I played through it before trying hard mode and still couldn't get through one of the puzzles) but also a nice and simple casual mode that lets you skip puzzles that just aren't your thing. I'm big into that being important in games like this where I hate being stuck because of one single puzzle.

I liked the voice acting, it's not perfectly timed, but it wasn't awful.

Pros
+ Beautiful art
+ Diverse puzzles
+ Different level settings
+ Atmospheric

Cons
- Shallow story
- Flat characters
- Hard mode is ridiculous

14024607.review:
Artifex Mundi sp. z o.o.	算是著名移动端解谜游戏公司，最大的特点是游戏全部有中文。本作我个人觉得在他家的游戏中算是不错的，附送的福利也是相当多；虽然也有玩家反映Steam端有闪退和Bug的问题，不过喜欢这类游戏的筒子依然可以在移动端尝试一下。

本作的剧情很简单，依然是女主救人+拯救世界的老套路，正片+DLC全成就通关也只有2-3小时左右，不过作为小游戏也不能太挑。画面比较优秀，属于精致的厚涂风；蒸汽朋克的元素在游戏各处都很明显，适合喜欢这种风格的筒子们。音乐和配音中规中矩，总体来说在小游戏里算不错的。

作为典型的 Hidden Object类游戏，本作的解谜个人觉得类型还算丰富，就是稍嫌简单了些。游戏中的找物品和剧情的关联性很好，而小游戏虽然没什么新意但还算有趣。本作有难度设置，不过直接上最高难度也能轻松通关；而且自带提示系统，因此不用担心卡关的问题。

最后，本作自带的福利很多，不仅有收集元素，还有免费的DLC、壁纸和BGM。虽然Steam版的价格不算太实惠（好像最高也就75 OFF），但是各位Hidden Object爱好者们和成就狂们可以考虑入手看看。

13836266.review:
Мир стимпанка, немцев и спрятанных предметов. 
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink - хорошая игра от Artifex Mundi, делающих отличные игры в жанре "поиск предметов". В этот раз они использовали интересный сеттинг, похожий на стимпанк (хотя и не в чистом виде). Сюжет довольно интересный, хоть и без чего-то выдающегося. Понравилось хорошее соотношение "головоломки/поиск предметов" - обычно вторых больше, здесь же наоборот, больше головоломок, что делает игру более разнообразной. Рисовка хороша, чего нельзя сказать об анимации, которая выглядит странной. А еще здесь есть девочка, которая заставила меня криповать :D
Кстати, если говорить о минусах, то тут их два. Первый - малая продолжительность игры, чем страдает большинство игр в этом жанре. Второй, более существенный - неудачная локализация, особенно это заметно во время поиска предметов. "Corn" перевели как "зерно", хотя нам надо найти кукурузу, также вместо бокалов в списке числятся кружки, да и еще есть пара таких примеров неверного перевода. Мне особо не помешало, но все же это важный минус.
Игру рекомендую любителям жанра и тем, кто ищет простенькую игру для расслабления. 6,5/10

13782159.review:
[h1]Short version: 86%[/h1]
A steampunk spy story set in an alternate universe pre-WWI Prussia, Clockwork Tales knows how to cater to both the adventure and hidden object game fans, even if only for a very short while.
	
[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a thrilling spy adventure set in a world best described as classic steampunk meets imperial Prussia somewhere around the start of the 20th century. The plot follows a female agent on the trail of her kidnapped mentor, only to find a sinister plot devised by a clichéd spy movie villain, which she naturally promptly foils. It’s cheesy and predictable, but written extremely well and acted out even better… just pure fun!

The video game aspects are done in the usual Artifex Mundi manner. If you know this developer, you will know most of the puzzles and hidden object scene types; although they may provide a few surprises as some of them are devilishly difficult.

But even the difficulty won’t help the short length (3 chapters with only a handful of locations), which makes Clockwork Tales less of a hidden object title and more an interactive adventure movie with puzzles.

I love snow covered landscapes, and the artwork in this game is really nice. You are immediately wrapped up in its atmospheric scenery. Unfortunately, that doesn't help you overlook the things that made me give this game a "thumbs down" rating.

Okay, so the bad immitation of a German accent you encounter in this game made me giggle, as German is my first language. Just, please, when you use elements of a foreign language in your games, make sure they are grammatically correct and also pronounced correctly -- which wasn't the case here. (For instance, it's "kleiner Spitzel" not "klein Spitzel".)

Apart from that, the game started out promising, but for the first time with any Artifex Mundi game, it quickly got boring. It just doesn't capture the real feel of steam punk for me, sorry. Some of the puzzles were challenging, although most of them seemed repetitive if you have played other Artifex Mundi adventures before.

This game is different from other similiar games in that it is heavy on the puzzles, light on the hidden object scenes, which could be a good or a bad thing depending on which you prefer. I also found it to be much easier and less complex than other HOGs I have played. If you are familiar with Artifex Mundi, you will also notice that some puzzles were taken directly from other games they've made (or perhaps the other way around...). 

Another issue, which I've found to be true with other such games, is that sometimes in the hidden object scenes, you will be directed to find, for example, a "hook," and there will be like 5 hooks in the scene, and you just have to keep guessing until you find the one they are referring to. An annoying oversight on the part of the game makers. 

In general the artwork and voice acting are both above average, and the story is super basic but acceptable. But you don't play these games for the story, you play them because you're bored, procrastinating on your work, or you don't feel like playing a "real game." It passes the time... not much else to say.

13205470.review:
I hesitate to call this a "hidden object game" in the traditional sense because the first real HOG screen doesn't appear until over halfway through the game.  They toss in a handful of FROG (fractured object) puzzles, and they give you a "find a bug in each location" challenge, but for the most part this is an extremely casual point and click adventure that happens to have a few hidden object puzzles contained in the mix of mini-games.  (This is not necessarily a bad thing, however I expected something a bit different after playing several of Artifex Mundi's other titles.)  

Speaking of the mini-games, I noticed at least three of them were directly copied from "Abyss: The Wraiths of Eden."  I understand that a company needs to meet deadlines, but ripping off your own past work to flesh out your current game is a pretty disappointing tactic.

Due to the sparsity of HOG's, there was no alternate puzzle solution option for this game (such as dominoes or mahjong).  While this is a significantly more simplified level of gameplay than I have come to expect from this studio, it does allow the player to complete all of the achievements in one playthrough.  They also did not include any time challenges for this game.  

Aside from the puzzles, the adventure game elements were fairly intuitive, there wasn't too much backtracking, the story was decent enough, the art was good, the character designs and voice acting were well done, and there was even a bit of humour thrown into the dialogue.  I also liked the inclusion of an animal companion who doubles as a special use item (something that seems to be a bit of a trend with this studio's more recent titles).  However, the game is not entirely immersive, and many of the challenges feel like a means to an end, rather than a fun progression of the plot.

Overall I would have to give this game a 6/10.   If you are expecting a HOG, you will be disappointed, but if you are just looking for a casual steampunk adventure game, it fits the bill well enough.

Clockwork Tales ist ein Wimmelbildspiel von Artifex Mundi im Steampunk-Style.

12835726.review:
If you like the Artifex Mundi style, then you'll probably like Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink. I have to admit, this developer has changed my opinion on hidden object games in general because their titles consistently manage to combine an engaging story with puzzles that are challenging but not taxing or tedious, quality artwork, and music and voice acting that suit the story well. Clockwork Tales delivers, and is probably one of my favorites in this genre.

I really like the Steampunk aesthetic, personally, so I thought it worked nicely into the format of a hidden object game. The bad guys here are militaristic fanatics with suspiciously German-sounding accents, so it's pretty obvious what imagery they were trying to evoke, but (pseudo-)Nazis blend well with the Steampunk style.  I was amused by the effort to include a bit of a science/geology theme in some of the puzzles and in the story, and I also appreciated that (like several of the other AM games I have played) the protagonist of the story was female.

Clockwork Tales is not terribly difficult or long, and the game probably lacks much replay value, It's still pretty entertaining and I enjoyed the few hours I spent playing. The achievements can be won in just a few hours of casual gameplay, so if that's your thing, then this is your game. It's also a family-friendly game as most of the puzzles aren't too difficult and the theme isn't very scary.

12802838.review:
★★★★☆ - Hodnocení v rámci žánru Hidden object

Kupoval jsem za 2.59 euro a mohu doporučit. Dohrál jsem na nejlehčí obtížnost bez HINTů a přeskakování miniher za 5 a půl hodiny.

Pěkná steampunková hledačka od Artifex Mundi, normálně bych dal i 5 hvězd, ale jelikož jsem u tohoto vývojářského týmu zvyklý na precizně odvedenou práci, musím tentokrát jednu hvězdu ubrat. Grafika, hratelnost, hudba, dialogy, videosekvence, nové nápady, puzzle, bonusy a další, to je vše opět parádní. Bohužel v tom všem jsem dvě vady na kráse našel. 

Kromě psaných skrytých objektů, zde občas hledáš i předměty, které jsou pouze zobrazené v dolní HO liště. na tom by nebylo nic špatného, kdyby zobrazení předmětů nebylo tak malinké a neurčité. Člověk tam pak šilhá jak exot a ani neví, co vlastně hledá. Druhým nedostatkem je naklikávání u některých objektů a puzzlů. Občas je potřeba na něco kliknout víckrát, než to hra akceptuje. To samé se děje i u některých puzzle miniher. Je to matoucí a frustrující. Naštěstí takových situací není ve hře příliš, ale jsou tam.

+ Přiměřená rozsáhlost celé hry
+ Nové nápady
+ Rychlé přesouvání pomocí mapy

+ Dialogy

12645305.review:
Hidden Object games do get a lot of flak, and I must admit to being one of their harshest critics.  This is primarily because some companies who once made standard point and click adventures have instead jumped ship to these games.  Focus Multimedia are an example taking the Art of Murder and Chronicles of Mystery series from point and click to Hidden Object games in their later instalments.

The trouble is that a lot of these games are made on a budget, one that is very tight and they often look it.  The gameplay is often usually a few scenes and some random objects in a list.  There are exceptions however in this genre and I'm please to say Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is one of these.  DON'T go in expecting a point and click, it is still an HOG but at least it appears to be of decent quality and the game length isn't bad.

I got hold of this in a sale on Steam and it was worth the money.

Picked up Clockwork Tales: Of Glass And Ink during a sale, right after completing Nightmares Of The Dark: Cursed Heart from the same game publisher.
You play a female secret agent investigating the disappearance of a steampunk scientist in a small mountain town. It quickly becomes clear he has stumbled upon a great danger for the entire world.
The main game is a point & click adventure, combined with some sub-games; mostly, which are usually not too difficult to solve. Second there are the hidden object games, where you need to find a list of objects in a single scene. 
I still recommend this game as it is still quite entertaining, but this certainly isn't the best game in its genre. The main and bonus story can be completed in 3 hours or even less. Compared to Cursed Heart the story of Clockwork Tales wasn't very captivating either...

Score: 6/10

Pro: 
+ nice graphics
+ additional bonus story

Contra:
- really too short

12220271.review:
I would definitely recommend Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink, as it is a beautiful hidden-object adventure game.  The game also has a great little story, with some quirky characters, which makes it highly entertaining and enjoyable.
However, compared to other Artifex Mundi games it falls a little short, and it lacks replay ability.  

Other Artifex Mundi games have the ability to skip hidden-object areas for bonus games, such as dominos, or matching memory games.  Clockwork Tales does not have this option, and for people (like me) who enjoy completing the game in every way possible, you lose a reason to replay the game.  It is very easy to play though the game and get all the achievements in one sitting, which while good for some players, isn’t as good for others.

Clockwork Tales is definitely worth playing if you enjoy these types of games, and especially if you enjoy Artifex Mundi games, as they are always very well polished, and highly enjoyable.  Just do not expect the game to last more than a few hours, even if grinding the achievements.  Take Clockwork Tales for what it is, as there is a very enjoyable experience to be had.

Momentan spiel ich meine Wimmelbild-Sammlung durch. Nun, Clockwork Tales ist erstmal ein sehr faires Spiel. Damit meine ich, das die Grafik gut genug ist um die Gegenstände ohne Probleme zu erkennen und auch nicht nach Sachen gesucht wird, die zum größten Teil von anderen verdeckt werden. Die Story hinter dem Spiel könnte recht interessant sein, allerdings verschenkten die Programmierer hier eigentlich alles, vor allem das Ende ist unbefriedigend. Außerdem ist mit knapp 5 Stunden Spielzeit inclusive finden aller Bonuskäfer, durchspielen des Bonus-Levels und einigen Pausen das Game extrem kurz.
Empfehlen kann ich es daher nur jemanden, der mal in diese Wimmelbilder reinschnuppern will und wenn das Game runtergesetzt ist, immerhin macht es genügend Spass und ist günstiger als ein Kinobesuch.

12112003.review:
Part hidden object, part adventure, Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a fun adventure game with some interesting puzzles to challenge you.  The game edges on the short side and as a result, the story is over before it gets a chance to develop.

Play this as a casual adventure game to pass the time. If you really like adventure games and don't want to miss out on any of them, then Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is one of the better games amongst the myriad of choices that have sprung up over the past year or so.

A must play if you're looking for a quick fix for your adventure game addiction, or casual gamers alike.

12075945.review:
It's quite a nice game, but not that full of action as the description makes you believe. There are no fights, flying or whatever. Okay, you can watch those things in the cutscenes, but not really do them yourself. This is, why I'm a bit upset. I guess, the description is highly exaggerated! 

Nevertheless it's a good game. It's a kind of point and click adventure, but with much more puzzles than usual point and click games have, and there are also many, many hidden object scenes.
Usually I hate that hidden object stuff, but playing this game was really fun! :)

I also like the places and animations in this game. Mathew the crow is really beautiful, I love this one! 
You can really see that those people who made this game spent a lot of time and joy on creating this.

12025408.review:
As far as Artifex Mundi's Hidden Object Games go, this one is better than Abyss, but still not as good as Alex Hunter. It's almost as though the developer wanted to make their own "Clockwork Man" game, but gave you a robot bird helper instead of a man. At least it utilizes its Steampunk theme way better than that series did. The bird has some useful talents that are actually required to retrieve certain objects, providing a neat twist on the genre. It feels like the actual Hidden Object scenes are getting fewer and farther between in these games, and have an art style not quite up to par with the rest of the game's beautiful scenery, but at least the puzzle-solving aspect is fairly involved, even though many of them are similar to puzzles in other HOGs. Although it's only in the bonus chapter, the sewer cap puzzle in this game is lifted *directly* from Abyss - it's literally the same puzzle and screens. I'm not sure whether to take that as a moment of homage, or as a sign that the developers are starting to rest on their laurels too much.

Oh, and there's a part that involves giving catnip to a cat. I guess that should count for something.
Rating: 3/5

I love these Artifex Mundi games. They have great visuals, intruiging settings, and casual gameplay, and whatever they lack in challenge, they more than make up for in the pleasantness of the experience. It reminds me of reading a particularly satisfying book, and specifically/necessarily one that comes from the "Young Adults" section, as it is not exactly overflowing with complexity but is still highly enjoyable. 

This game gets high marks in most areas except story resolution. It seems like it abruptly ends, and I was irked and dissatisfied by the conclusion to a degree; Clockwork Tales, for the most part is vibrant, lush and well-executed, but has a very rushed and non-climactic ending. It is as if the timer for the project went off, and everything had to be turned in 'as is'. Still: [ 7 / 10 ]

11651158.review:
Zabrzańskie studio Artifex Mundi jest dobrze znany wśród wielbicieli przygodówek- tym razem twórcy zaprezentowali nam bardzo przyjemną grę Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink, opowiadającą o przygodach agentki Evangeliny Glass. Gra jest casualową przygodówką z silnym akcentem na ukryte obiekty i puzzle, spodoba się nawet graczom stroniącym od przygodówek jak od ognia (w tym autor niniejszej recenzji )- Artifex mundi wielokrotnie udowodniło że potrafi robić gry bardzo estetycznie wykonane, dysponując bardzo małym budżetem potrafi wykonać gry dające mnóstwo frajdy.

Jak już wspomniałem, w grze kierujemy krokami agentki wywiadu Glass, która przybywa do miasta w odpowiedzi na niepokojący list wysłany przez doktora Ambrose Ink'a, dotyczący dziwnych trzęsień ziemi i powiązanego z nimi Gerharda Barbera. Kierując kroki przez kilkadziesiąt statycznych plansz rozwiązujemy zagadki, szukamy przedmiotów, jednak- co warto dodać- tym co wyróżnia tą grę  (oraz inne od Artifex Mundi) wśród innych przygodówek (także tych z ogromnym budżetem ) jest to, że zagadki są skonstruowane bardzo logicznie, nie zbieramy setek przedmiotów, aby przez kolejne godziny szukać piksela na setnej planszy, na którym użyjemy np. sera (vide Sam & Max Sezon 1z 2006)- to rozwiązanie powinno bardzo przypaść do gustu graczom, którzy nie znoszą przygodówek, a jednak chcieli by im dać szansę. Wracając do historii- akcja dzieje się w mieście Hochwald, przywodzącym na myśl wioskę w Bawarii, sama postać Barbera przypomina moim zdaniem „miks” standardowo przedstawianego w filmach oficera SS z Cesarzem Willhelmem II, warto też dodać, iż całość jest utrzymana w klimatach Steampunk'owych i przypomina trochę okres tuż przed I Wojną Światową- zeppeliny, produkty rewolucji przemysłowej, nowe wynalazki itd. Fabuła jest bardzo ciekawa i naprawdę wciąga.

Kwintesencją gry są jednak zagadki i puzzle- i za to gromkie brawa dla twórców: łowienie ukrytych obiektów jest bardzo wciągające, warto wytężać wzrok bez podpowiedzi (oczywiście że są!), bowiem w grze jest do zdobycia garść osiągnięć STEAM, które można bardzo łatwo zdobyć w całosci- trzeba tylko uzbroić się w cierpliwość. Oprócz standardowych ukrytych obiektów, mamy całą gamę zagadek logicznych, oraz układanek. Brzmi to strasznie siermiężnie, ale uwierzcie- wykonanie i estetyka tychże zagadek jest na naprawdę wysokim poziomie!

Tym co w grze spodobało mi się, oprócz bardzo ciekawej historii i logicznie prowadzonego wątku fabularnego jest oczywiście grafika- autorzy postawili na bardzo starannie wykonane statyczne plansze, ręcznie malowane, bardzo oszczędnie wykorzystując animacje (są to raczej poklatkowe rysunki). Każda lokacja jest wykonana z pieczołowitością i polotem- naprawdę wszędzie mamy do czynienia w ten czy inny sposób ze steampunk'iem- w grze kapie wręcz od hmm... nazwałbym to od rewolucji przemysłowej, wszędzie pojawiają się koła zębate, maszyny latające, a nawet konstrukty. Pod względem graficznym mogę się przyczepić tylko do jednego- postaci nie zawsze są udane, w szczególności dziewczynka, której musimy naprawić lalkę została wykonana nie najlepiej- ale to jest czepialstwo z mojej strony być może.
W grze przygrywa również bardzo miła dla ucha muzyczka- powiedziałbym że jest bardzo relaksująca, nie- nie usypiająca, ale relaksująca w przyjemny sposób. O odgłosach otoczenia, przedmiotów i postaci nie można powiedzieć nic złego- tyłka „nie urywają”, są po prostu starannie zrobione.

Uważam że warto zainteresować się tą przygodówką studia Artifex Mundi, oprócz wyżej wymienionych cech gra ma jedną olbrzymią zaletę: gra nie „wywyższa” się, twórcy po prostu zrobili bardzo dobry produkt, który broni się sam, nie potrzebując grafiki robionej na stacjach roboczych, olbrzymich nakładów marketingowych i całej „propagandy” . Czułem wręcz że to gra zrobiona przez graczy dla graczy, po to żeby dobrze się bawić, a nie zdzierać olbrzymie kwoty od graczy.

Clockwork Tales to gra, która spodoba się większości graczy- Osoby które grają okazyjnie, zapiekli Skyrimowcy, czy „World of Tankerzy” również wieczorami odnajdą w tej grze mnóstwo przyjemnej i relaksującej „nieinwazyjnej” rozgrywki. Miłośnicy przygodówek znajdą w tej grze wytchnienie od przytłaczających czasami abstrakcyjnych zagadek, tak jak wspomniałem gra jest casualem na kilka godzin, gra nie przytłacza gracza ogromem, skomplikowaniem. 
Tym razem nie podaję oceny, myślę że każdy powinien grę ocenić sam (choćby grając w demo), niemniej warto mieć w swojej kolekcji przynajmniej jeden  produkt od rodzimych producentów z Zabrza i sprawdzić na własnej skórze czy to jest to „co tygrysy lubią najbardziej” :)

11543865.review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink is a point-and-click puzzle game which pays homage to deceased Polish author Jan Brzechwa's series of stories surrounding Pan Kleks/Mr. Inkblot. Developed by Artifex Mundi, it was originally released in August of 2013, and put onto Steam in April of 2014, with achievements and trading cards. The game itself follows Evangeline Glass as she tries to help her mentor and friend, Dr. Ambrose Ink, investigate a series of increasingly violent tremors rocking the planet and seemingly originating in the nestled burg of Hochwald. After his abduction early on, it falls entirely to Evangeline to not only solve the mystery surrounding the quakes and save Hochwald, but rescue Ink from his captors.

The premise is interesting, and to its credit, more involved than a lot of hidden object games, but not quite up to snuff for me. The characters are flat and lacking nuance, the plot as a whole is predictable, and while the environment and all the build up hints at a great backstory and lore that could have been explored and exposited, it all remains veiled in mystery. There's no elaboration about the world the characters live in, how its technology works, or even how our main ensemble got to where they are in their lives; everything is left entirely up to our own interpretation. While that can work well when you're at least given breadcrumbs to go off of, we aren't, and I feel the game suffers as a result. I can't really claim that the game is meant to be played with previous knowledge of the Pan Kleks stories, either, seeing as they aren't mentioned anywhere within the game as a source of inspiration — something that I can't dismiss as being a bit of an odd exclusion.

The goal is outlined fairly early on, and doesn't change at any point thereafter. The ending felt incredibly rushed, and didn't leave me satisfied that things had been finished at all. The dénouement as a whole was fairly lackluster — the final cinematic runs is an expository narrative about how things were all wrapped up off camera after doing the final few clicks, clocking in at less than two minutes long to do so. It came off more as a segue to more story than a resolution, or even a cliffhanger for a sequel.

Gameplay is, of course, looking around and clicking things. While primarily presented as a hidden object game, and indeed offering such as its main minigame challenge, the selection of puzzles is surprisingly diverse. Nonograms, jigsaws, sliding blocks, labyrinths, object interactions, trick locks and associated puzzle boxes… More than a few varieties make an appearance, and can pose a decent challenge depending on your familiarity with each. There are, however, skip options for every puzzle, allowing you to bypass them completely by simply idling for a bit.

Finishing the main story will likely only take you a few hours, with the bonus chapter taking much less. Due to the linear progression and lack of variance in how to move forward, the game has fairly little replayability, but the initial experience can be quite fun. Once you finish a mode, you must play through it again entirely if you want to return to a specific point, as each individual zone of the game is walled of from returning to the previous; the downside to this is that having to go through the game again, as in the event that you miss a Steambug, can be more of a chore than anything else. A post-finish stage selection option would have been quite appreciated for this.

Visually, the game has a virtual painterly aesthetic, with fade-between transitions for a majority of background animations. During cut scenes, speaking characters have their facial expressions smudged about to convey emotion and communication, while the rest of the scene remains static or animated using the fade-between method. Although the smudging effect is one of the more high quality examples I have seen, the lack of use on anything other than the characters' primary features can be a bit jarring, primarily at times when their heads should be moving as well. I would have liked to see the effect used on more areas of the game than it was, as it could have added to give the game a bit of individuality.

Musically, the soundtrack is quite enjoyable; I had no complaints. I particularly liked the track that plays during the nonogram puzzles, although it only makes a single appearance toward the end. Unfortunately, the tracks listed in the Extras menu are not the full selection, and checking the installation directory doesn't offer the raw files, forcing one to pursue other venues to listen to everything on the fly.

The voice work varies between decent and hilariously bad, usually landing somewhere in the middle. A few characters sound absolutely ridiculous, while others are very pleasing to the ears. You can disable voice acting entirely in the options menu, should you so desire.

I encountered no sequence breaking opportunities or unwinnable situations while playing, but I didn't attempt to induce them, either. I did experience a rather annoying issue where the Spy Master achievement didn't go through during my initial Expert run, despite having kept the game set to Expert throughout the entire session.

While the difficulty settings speak of some sort of penalty for misclicks in hidden object puzzles, I was still able to click about at random on both Advanced and Expert and not have it affect anything. I'm not entirely sure if I'm unique in that regard, or if it's simply an aspect that was never implemented. If you're hunting for achievements, and with this in mind, I'd set it to Expert right away so you can get the Spy Master achievement on your first playthrough. The game isn't hard enough nor punishing enough to truly make doing so pose much of an issue, especially if you're accustomed to games of this genre or are willing to utilize the skip function.

The store page is a bit deceptive. You have no control over the glider section, it happens entirely as a cut scene; there's no combat action to the game, as “monster battles” and “defeating mechanical creatures” implies (this action is done entirely via puzzle-solving, and only occurs once); and there are 16 achievements both in-game and on Steam, not 9. The game is very much of the go-at-your-leisure variety, with no timed puzzles or direct fighting involved. These are fairly minor discrepancies, but still a bit misleading as to what one can expect.

As a whole, I would recommend the game to fans of the genre, and those looking for an introduction to point-and-clicks without too extreme a difficulty. The standard asking prices in several currencies are $7.99 USD and AUD, 6.49€, 5.99£, R$ 13,99, and 189 RUB. By comparison as of August 2014, the game is cheapest in RUB. As is par for the course with Steam games, I would recommend getting it while on sale or in a bundle, unless you're a diehard fan of games like it.

11491170.review:
Clockwork Tales: Of Glass and Ink è un'avventura punta e clicca hidden object, come tutti i giochi della Artifex Mundi.

Questo titolo non brilla ne per storia (solamente abbozzata in cui si notano molte lacune) ne per lunghezza (storia principale + avventura bonus finite in 4 ore); gli enigmi sono di facile soluzione.

Personalmente credo ci siano titoli migliori di questo sviluppatore, come ad esempio Nightmare from the Deep.
Può valerne la pena se trovato in bundle, ma non a prezzo pieno.

11488268.review:
HOPA от Artifex Mundi в довольно редкой стилистике смеси "клокпанка" и "электропанка". Анимация невероятно жуткая, озвучка тоже страшная. Графически игра довольно слабая, а вот стилистика у игры очень хорошая: в те моменты, когда отсутствует какое-либо движение выглядит всё довольно интересно и приятно. Только вот игра немножко отвлекается от заданной тематики, в качестве достижений предлагается ловить steambugs, при том, что ничто в их внешнем виде не подразумевает паровых котлов и печей. Технически игра работает гладко, но пытается подстроится под разрешение, без каких-либо ручных настроек графики. Даже если соотношение сторон 4:1.

Сюжетно игра совершенно не принадлежит к какому-либо из "панк" жанров, и только эксплуатирует их стилистику. Небольшая простенькая история про злых изобретателей и расследование. Притом даже есть какие-то намёки на персонажей, но ни один из них не раскрывается. [spoiler]Например Барбер: почему бы ему вдруг надо устраивать конец света, используя изобретения отца, направленные на его предотвращение? Если занырнуть в отхожую яму поиска глубинного смысла, то можно с натяжкой сказать, что Барбер старший так сильно любил людей, что тратил всё время на их спасение и не уделял его сыну. А тот из-за ревности и злости на батьку решил убить всё, что ему было дорого.[/spoiler]

А вот с механикой у игры всё отлично, я бы даже сказал, что это одна из лучших игр в жанре. Собственно HO там очень немного, да и из тех - три четверти относятся к поиску деталей в куче. Перебор случайных предметов по названиям тоже есть, но довольно редок и все сцены отрисованы художником, а на вброшены вырезками с помощью photoshop. Кроме того они и выглядят не такими захламлёнными, да и отлично вписываются в окружения. Единственное что напрягает - между двумя посещениями одной и той же кучи в ней могут появится новые предметы, что - как-то глупо. В остальном задачки вполне стандартные и простенькие, так же есть оригинальная механика с использованием ручного механического ворона, но она недостаточно закреплена и используется довольно редко. Из-за этого довольно легко попасть в тупик, забыв про его существование.

Дополнительная глава довольно интересна, но как-то уж слишком забита головоломками, следующими одна за другой.

Достижения на коллекционирование, на прохождение и на трудность. Но есть и довольно странные, которые вставлены то ли  для измерения реакции игроков, то ли для принуждения к ознакомление со всем содержанием. Например поговорить со всеми людьми или не пропустить ни одного страшного ролика. Все рабочие, выполнены в одном стиле.
Карточки вышли довольно хорошие, да и изображения в них высокого\среднего качества (в зависимости от точки зрения), демонстрирующие стилистику во всей красе. Значки простенькие, но выстроены в серию. Эмотиконы большей частью не удались, а фоны профиля вполне хороши, тем более в данном случае они безоговорочно высокого разрешения.

В целом это одна из лучших HOPA, где PA значительно больше чем HO, и несмотря на довольно слабое представление и малую длину - выбранная стилистка очень редка и стоит того.

11448475.review:

Яркие, красивые локации, интересные головоломки! Музыка приятная. Самое главное - сюжет увлекательный.

11349515.review:
Clockwork Tales has all of the usual trappings of the genre, but occasionally it uses hidden object scenes to make you search for items needed to progress rather than for chess pieces, a cat and an egg beater (although you do have to look for those in some scenes because of course you do).

In some scenes the characters are animated which was a nice change although it does look a little odd, the voice acting ranges from acceptable to annoying, the music is pretty good and the puzzles were challenging enough (although some are really easy). The story is fairly standard fair. Rescue an old wise bloke from an evil guy with a moustache who wants to 'RULE ZE VERLD MUAHAHAHA!'.

If you're a fan of HOGs and want something that is a little different from other titles then this is well worth picking up.

11250984.review:
Whe I play a Hidden Object/ Adventure game I want the puzzles to be fair. They can be hard or easy but they must fit into the game world and make somekind of sense. I also want a story with an actual narrative. The crime of many HO games is that you simply have some game character saying something between HO scenes.

Fortunatly Clockwork Tales fits my criteria I layed out for a good HO game. Curiously, the story kinda reminded me of the adventure game Syberia (no - this game does not come close to that game at all). 

The game does have one unique feature. Your protagonist has a companion. A companion you have to use occasionally to solve some of the puzzles.

HO games are always good to me for some pleasant gaming, but still requires me to use some brain and observational power. I would like to see more HO adventures from this protagonist.

11074811.review:
I originally had this game from Bigfish, so I knew what I was getting into when I bought it here. The fact that I would purchase a game twice should say something all by itself, but I am biased; I happen to very much enjoy Hidden Object/casual games like this one. What intrigued me the most was the steampunk setting and it does a decent job of making you feel you're in a steampunk world the whole time.

As most HOs, the story is quite short, but what is there is beautiful, fun, and with fun puzzles to solve in your quest to find your mentor and friend, with the help of his mechanical crow, Matthew. First off, Matthew is a sidekick of sorts, chilling out in your inventory and looking awesome, but he's very useful in retrieving items and spying for you where normally you might break your neck if you tried yourself. Matthew is just overall a cool feature, and I wish players got more chances to use him. If you're bored of the crow, there are also hidden robotic bugs in many of the scenes which you can collect for completionist status; a nice little extra challenge, though relatively easy to do. The epilogue chapter helps to add a little more story, gameplay and depth as well. A little more bang for your buck.

Overall, the artwork and scenery in this game is gorgeous, and for once, the voice-acting actually adds to the game rather than takes away from it, even if a few lines are repetitive after asking for Matthews help. The music isn't anything spectacular; it's nothing award-winning but it doesn't make me want to turn it off at any point during the game either. Calm and pretty for the most part - which is exactly what you'll be getting with this purchase. Calm and pretty.

11051246.review:

Good game for a casual puzzle session.

10968882.review: This is a short (I blew through this game in a about 3 hours) point and click game. The storyline was a bit convoluted but not the worst I've seen. And despite the "hidden object" tag, it's not a hidden object game. Rather, there were a few hidden object puzzles scattered throughout but the vast majority of the puzzles were of the "make a pattern" or "solve this" variety. I'm not sure I would have paid the full $8 price for this, but if it's on sale, it's a decent value.

10115266.review:
Right first things first,yes this is a hidden object game and yes there are loads of them,but this ones actually really good.
The graphics in game are good and mostly of the static variety (like most of these games are) but sometimes this shifts to moving scenes which are handle'd with a real flair and the art work is top notch.The sound is really good in game and really helps set the "STEAM PUNK" astmosphere that this game goes for and the characters are all well writen and the script also gets top marks for real effort and is both entertaining and also interesting to watch and listen to as the story progresses and never gets boring or out stays its welcome right up until the game nears its inevitable conclusion.
The hidden object scenes are never to trick'y and the puzzles sometimes cause you to sit there and scratch your head (but not very often and only a little bit),but this doesnt matter as whats there is really enjoyable to play through and pushes you on to yet another puzzle or hidden object scene that you will enjoy (if you like these sort of games that is).
You play as Agent Evangeline Glass who is set on her mission to save Dr. Ink and stop a crafty mechanical genius who always seems to be one step ahead of you (but you know that eventually you will and must stop him-wouldent be much of a game if we didnt have to).You have to stop the earthquakes and rescue the Dr before all hell breaks lose and more cities fall (seems rather dramatic but that's the gist of what you have to do in the story-solving puzzles as you go).
As you play you will meet various other NPC's but the most interesting of these and the most fun is the mechanical crow Matthew,he comes into his own at times and without him you would both be stuck and at times lost in the world around you (he really does remind me of BUBO though from the old "CLASH OF THE TITANS" movie).
You see at certain points there are objects you just cant reach or places you just cant get to that Matthew can fly upto and either grab that item or help you solve that puzzle thats been getting on your nerves for the last 30 minutes AARRGGHHHHHH,and most of the time you will say "OF COURSE I NEEDED MATTHEW TO SOLVE THAT LAST BIT DUH" but thats all part of his charm as your companion.
All in all one of the better hidden object games its been my privalige to play and i hope that we get to see MATTEW again as that little crow really has taken a place in my subconscious and he refuses to leave "SHOO crow of with you"...........................see hes not listening".
